title: TikTok

review: It seems like every day there are more and more restrictions being placed on creators, but not much is done about the really bad videos or accounts. There are obvious cases of ‚Äúgrooming‚Äù, targeted at both adults and children. There are people doing hard drugs, nearly completely naked, doing explicit sexual acts or raunchy suggestive routines. There is a MASSIVE amount of hate speech, racism, homophobia, religious persecution, and other prejudice. Extremely dangerous misinformation, radical opinions expressed on such a way as to incite hate, violence, or vandalism. Self harming, serious threats being made, harassment (extremely common), dangerous advice, slander and libel, the list goes on and on...and so many of them get reported multiple times but somehow don‚Äôt violate community standards??? They allow songs about everything under the sun, including marijuana, and have stickers pertaining to marijuana, but we aren‚Äôt allowed to talk about it or tag it or build a community around this medicinal plant, that has been legalized for medicinal and/or recreational use and decriminalized in a vast majority of states in the US. I believe there are 2 states left where it is completely illegal (They should try and keep up!) Until the algorithm is fixed and so are the ways in which the guidelines are enforced, I‚Äôm being generous with 2 stars. TikTok, DO BETTER.
title: Community guidelines have gotten out of control

review:
TikTok is a great app, but I feel like it would be even better if viewers like me and everyone else who likes to from time to time watch some Tik Toks in a short period of time. For instance: you would like to show a friend something funny that you watched in a Tik Tok, ...unfortunately it was at the end of the video. So now you have to wait to show them the absolute comedy gold. At first that doesn‚Äôt seem so bad does it. Although  something to take in to consideration is that not everybody has time to watch all of a video just to get to the good part. That‚Äôs where my idea comes into play. I think that TikTok  should make a feature that includes fast forwarding and reversing the video to the exact point you want it at. 
   Otherwise I love this app. It is a way to be yourself and be creative in your own way. If you don‚Äôt want to do that, it‚Äôs also a good to pass time or just have a few laughs. Better yet it‚Äôs a way to find common ground with other people who like similar stuff that you do. 
   I personally like it a lot, but I know some don‚Äôt. And that‚Äôs ok with me. And if you decide you like it too. I‚Äôll also be thrilled. In the end it‚Äôs you opinion of the app. This is only what I think of it. So what I am trying to say is I like, but don‚Äôt feel like you have too.

review: Hi! I love your app but have several complaints. I get the fact that you want to protect those people under 16, but that should be a parental decision. You can always make it so that a parent controls what settings you are controlling right now, as people like my parents are also on TT and now can‚Äôt send me messages over it as you have ‚Äúrestricted these settings for your safety.‚Äù Instead, make that a parent‚Äôs choice and make it clear you aren‚Äôt liable for what happens with their choices! I know you probably won‚Äôt read this review, but there are many kids whose parents (like mine) would be totally fine with people I don‚Äôt follow commenting on my videos. Kids can be smart too. If they are bullied, they can tell their parents! It should not be the app‚Äôs decision to block things when the parents can always connect to the account and do that themselves! Just make it clear that you are not liable for a parent‚Äôs or child‚Äôs decisions on your app. Especially on something like privacy settings. That is the choice of the person whose account it is or their parents. Many apps with age restrictions approach it with the parents as the ones deciding those things instead of the app for reasons like these.

review:
Was skeptical about downloading TT due to the rumors.  However, was pleasantly surprised by how easy and fun it is to use and the level of diversity.  I found myself laughing and feeling inspired and motivated with TT.  It renewed my desire to engage because TT is a whole ‚Äúcome as you are vibe‚Äù no need to put on airs or try to fit into any kind of mold to get views and likes.  

Additionally, I abandoned social media for years because of the negativity and horrible vibrations I could feel through my phone \ computer.  With TT I don‚Äôt feel that vibe and am learning a lot of great information, seeing fascinating art and designs, talented and hilarious people and I also see others collaborating and connecting with one another.  

All in all TT is one of best social media platforms to choose if you are just starting out and wanting to build a following for personal or business reasons.  It makes you feel like you are a part of something, instead of feeling like you have to remain in the fringes.  Support and engagement is easy and encouraged and won‚Äôt make you feel super exposed and vunerable.  Seems to have a different more positive algorithm and vibration.

review: It took me a while to try out TikTok because I had heard negative stuff about it in the news and by people that judged it even though they had never tried it (like me).  But my sister convinced me to try it so thankfully I finally did! It took me a short time to get the algorithm to show me what I wanted but once it did it just got better at it and I can change it by consuming different content that interests me at the moment. It has been the best social media experience I‚Äôve ever had. You don‚Äôt have to be someone special to get engagement or really connect like Twitter or Instagram. TikTok is a real community and I don‚Äôt feel like some lurking outcast there. Everyday I learn multiple amazing new things. My FYP has gardening, history, crafts, politics, economics, weather, world events, news not even covered by msm, music, cooking, and all the other things I‚Äôm interested in. It even has cute & funny animals, hilarious skits & comedy, and video lives of relaxing thunderstorms or beaches! The other SM apps left me with constant anxiety or just weren‚Äôt enjoyable. Now all of them are meh and I deleted them all. Thank you TikTok and TikTok creators! ü´∂

Other faith creators aren‚Äôt losing followers. I thought it was the niche. They then told me it‚Äôs because of inauthentic followers which I don‚Äôt believe because then we would all be affected. I think this is another glitch of the the system like their many other glitches. I saw a faith creator who had about 1.6 million followers. TikTok deleted her account because she is underage. She‚Äôs actually in her late 30‚Äôs. She had to start over. Many people have experienced this. I have been to a live once where this guy (he has about 5 million followers) exposed their private parts. I reported the live and nothing happened. I wouldn‚Äôt have children on the app.

So TikTok has done much for me because it‚Äôs given me a platform that o post my content, but when you work hard and see follower‚Äôs dropping - what is that? title: The things they allow is disgusting

review: Used to think it was an amazing app, but people (especially small creators) have been getting banned for things that don‚Äôt apply to anything they‚Äôve posted. Common ‚Äúreasons‚Äù are adult or minor nudity when the creator was covered completely in all of their videos. Often the video that was wrongly taken down was months old, I‚Äôve heard of people appealing it, getting the video back, but getting post banned anyway. It happens repeatedly until it‚Äôs to the point where you‚Äôd be better off just making a new account because you‚Äôre always post banned. It doesn‚Äôt help that it‚Äôs incredibly hard to get TikTok‚Äôs attention to get these issues fixed, even when you email them it‚Äôs obvious that you‚Äôre talking to a computer that doesn‚Äôt understand what you‚Äôre asking. This doesn‚Äôt even cover half of everything starting to go wrong with this app, just what I think is the biggest thing. Many creators have already left TikTok due to mainly this issue (shadowban is also a big contributor to people quitting) and many more continue to leave as this app proceeds to ignore these issues. Like I said, I used to love this app, but it gets more frustrating with each passing day as I see more and more of my favorite creators quit. It‚Äôs to the point where I‚Äôm considering deleting the app.
title: Unfair/no application of guidelines

review: I love TikTok. I personally use TikTok to have something to do and talk about to my friends. Usually people are really nice and supportive but people can get out of hand with shaming people as a joke when it‚Äôs really not funny at all, I‚Äôve even caught myself hating it just comes and goes and I try to stay away from it. TikTok is my most used app and I have 30+ hours on it every week and idek how. There are a few things I would change and it would be that you can have more control who views your videos. I still want my friends and the public to be able to see my videos but also I want to be able to block a specific person from just one video instead of blocking them from my Paige. That would make you feel a lot more comfortable with posting because I‚Äôm not the most popular kid in my school and there are kids out there just trying to put you down for fun. But overall great app and I give it a whopping 5 stars even tho there are a few small problems. :)

review:

However, the past month and a half every time I try to post my videos go immediately ‚Äúunder review‚Äù and some stay that way. My videos don‚Äôt go against any guidelines. I even had videos taken down, and I would message asking why it was taken down, but no response. I would rewatch my taken down videos confused how it goes against community guidelines. Especially because I see similar content on my For You Page.  I recommend not harping people like this. Because it‚Äôs frustrating to me that I put hours into making TikToks only for them to never be seen because they are kept ‚Äúunder review‚Äù.
I recommend not putting peoples videos ‚Äúunder review‚Äù until someone reports the video for going against guidelines. And send a reason why, that way it will be clearer on why the video was taken down and what the creator can avoid doing in their next TikTok video.
I love TikTok and I want to keep using it, but if the server is still going to keep me from posting then I might leave. I‚Äôll try and contact TikTok if the issue isn‚Äôt resolved because I know I‚Äôm not the only one to have videos constantly under review.

I recently made a video that was actually me doing a trend that is on tiktok for halloween. It's a trend where you pore candle wax in water, and it will create the first letter of the person youre gonna marry. I tell you this because its a silly harmless tiktok that everyone is doing. About 3 minutes of me posting the video, someone reported it, and it was immediatly taken down without question. I was given the option to appeal which I did because the video I made didnt go against any guidlines (which I made sure to read to see if I actually did something) about 3 more minutes go by, and I'm told the same message except now it says that my appeal was denied. I understand we need this stuff for actual offensive and dangerous content, but I feel the reporter has too much power which leaves the appealer to have almost no say in the matter whether their video was offensive or not. Please fix this, I've dealt with this before, and many other popular creaters have as well and we're all tired of it.

review: TikTok is an amazing app that enables everyone to express themselves. To explain further, TikTok isn‚Äôt just a playful app, it‚Äôs a job. For some, it‚Äôs their only job, the only way they get to eat 3 meals a day. Without this app, think about the amount of people that will be unemployed. Think about the number of people will lose their safe space, and the number of people who will lose their entertainment, their excitement. I know I am just one person, and I am not even a spec on the Birds Eye view of the world, but I believe my voice can make a difference, as I am not ready to see my favorite app be no more. review: Well I am a 13 year old and my parents let me try out TikTok. At first, they were concerned about what‚Äôs on TikTok, but after me having it a few days, and of course, sending them a couple funny animal TikTok‚Äôs, they even got it themselves! There is a lot of diversity, and you can learn a lot from it. There is some inappropriate things on there but what I do, is I either scroll past the video or I press the button that says don‚Äôt show anything like this to me again. And, once I did that, it worked! Most of my friends have this app and I found some other students from my school and old school on it and connected with them! It‚Äôs really fun to make some new friends and connect with old ones. Some cool things I also found out is some hacks with math and that really helped me on my homework! I also found out how to become more organized and know where all of my stuff is! While it can be addictive, there are some posts that remind you that you may be scrolling for too long! But those are upon occasion. What I do, is before I sit down to watch TikTok I set a 15 minute reminder that I have to get up and do some things! I would really recommend this app for 12-16 year olds.

title: Tik tok is disappointing

review: So I‚Äôm just gonna get straight to the point. TikTok is unable maintain a consistent enforcement of its community guidelines since they will refuse to take down videos that are in clear violation of community guidelines (for example acts of violence against people and animals, derogatory speech, sexual exploit, etc) or when they do try to ‚Äòenforce‚Äô guidelines, the app takes down videos that do not violate them but are falsely reported by a mass of trolls or go against the app‚Äôs ‚Äòagenda‚Äô. For the latter case, TikTok does not make an effort to work with creators who have been falsely accused and will shows little regard to have the video restored in most situations. It is quite intolerable that the app allows people to exploit its community guidelines just to harass or silence creators. Also, important social issues/injustices that people try to use their platform to call attention to have been silenced by TikTok through either limiting video‚Äôs showing in its algorithm or outright taking down the video with little explanation. Overall, I hope that TikTok is able to do something about this issue soon because for an app that is directed towards all ages, it not only puts people at risk, but displays a cruel injustice that can be simply resolved if the administrators of this app showed any sense of appreciation, decency, and care to the users and creators that make their app popular enough to yield a living and paycheck.

review:
It slaps. But do you really need my advice?  Is anyone even reading this?  Stop.  Stop reading it.  STOP I SAID.  Whatever.  Keep reading then. I could do this all day. Taping away on my phone, wasting time we both could be spending enjoying TikTok. Wait is it TicTok or TikTok? Did you look?  Are you sure you‚Äôre not reading some review of a knock off app? Nevermind, it‚Äôs TikTok. Pretty sure.

If you‚Äôre still reading this congrats.  Only 2.1% of readers make it this far. And believe me, there is much much more to come.  Up next...actually there isn‚Äôt. This has been fun, for both of us, but it‚Äôs getting ridiculous, right? I mean, what is the point of this? Why, oh Lord, why? Why won‚Äôt he stop? And by ‚Äòhe‚Äô I mean me. Ok, that‚Äôs it. I‚Äôm calling it.  Once you start referring to yourself in the third person, it‚Äôs time to...do some other thing, or something.  I don‚Äôt know.  I never said I was good at reviews. Oh, right.  The review.  TikTok is good.  How‚Äôs that?  Believable?  It is true too.

I guess there was a lot more after all. Sorry about that.  In conclusion, if you read this far, maybe TikTok isn‚Äôt for you after all.  Instead, make some human friends.  Peace.
title: Important and fun.

review: This app is a very entertaining and amazingly functional app. TikTok has a very addictive function that allows you to scroll and even add things of your liking based on what you like, aren‚Äôt interested in, and more! You can add videos to your favorites and even make collections out of them. You can see the history of comments you‚Äôve made and videos you‚Äôve seen. My only problem is that one of my favorite and recent features has been removed from my TikTok. This month TikTok added this recording feature which many call ‚Äústory mode‚Äù. Many users have commented on this feature on how much they love it and appreciate TikTok adding this feature! However, more recent to this, TikTok has removed this feature for many users. Including me. When recording videos to post or even just for myself I like features and filters that make me look flattering. Story mode had a specific camera function and cropping that changed the way it looked when recording. Simply cropping it isn‚Äôt the same as already recording with it. I‚Äôm hoping that you‚Äôll bring it back or reply to me with a solution to this, but I thought it‚Äôd be best to bring this to your attention.

title: Well it‚Äôs good but bad at the same time

review: The app is wonderful! I get to see so much content that I love! But you know what I don't love? The moderation. The system is either too harsh or not harsh enough, in just the past two days I've reported 7 different things that VERY MUCH violate the guidelines, and once it has been "reviewed" it was shown to have apparently not violated the guidelines. There is too much that the dev team lets the community get away with, and I understand that staff shouldn't be subjected to troubling and disturbing content but it reaches a certain point that there isn't any other choice than to have staff review reports. Not taking action against this issue is what enables people to continue violating your guidelines and until action is taken, people won't stop. To be able to make your platform a safe place, you need to hold your community accountable when it is actively hurting itself, and until you make it known that you're going to be taking action, people will continue abusing the lost reporting system. Unfortunately I don't expect a response, or even one that REALLY acknowledges what I said at all besides, " We understand your concern and will take it into consideration." Consideration isn't an option anymore, it needs to be done NOW.
title: The moderation is just not there

review:
For all of the parents who think that they shouldn't let their kids have TikTok. You may think "there is inappropriate things on there" TikTok's that are inappropriate get taken down because TikTok's moderating system is pretty good. "but what if old men or people I don't want following my kid follows them?" you can block people on TikTok or just make the account private so only certain people can follow you!! "how will I know what kind of stuff my child is watching?!" you can login to their account on your device so you can see what they watch. "what if someone comments something mean"
You can turn comments off. My parents used to think this exact same way, the way I convinced them to let me have TikTok was that they would login to my account from my device and see what I do and say. I recommend TikTok to everyone because it can easily inspire you and the fyp is customized to what you watch or what you like. you can see what your friends are doing and if you get enough followers then you can even make money from videos. anyways, thats all I had to say... please take what I said into consideration!

review: It‚Äôs really really fun I use it everyday but some videos can tend to be a little weird so don‚Äôt be surprised. Let me walk you through the basics about TikTok if you like a video double tap to like it and you can add it to your favorites too by clicking the bottom underneath the comment section which is the speech bubble. The comment section is that you and others that saw the same video can comment on it you can like others comments and you can also follow content creators by clicking the red plus underneath their profile pictures. You can also go to their page my swiping left. You can share the video too to some friends by clicking the arrow at the bottom and choosing what person you want to send the video to! You can also make videos people can like, comment, or follow you as well! That‚Äôs all I‚Äôm gonna tell you you‚Äôll find the rest on your own. Oh, and one last thing you can search people in TikTok including your friends or others just click the little magnifying glass at the top right of your screen. These are all the basics have fun and enjoy TikTok!

title: Good bye tik tok

review:
So, I‚Äôm a cosplayer and we‚Äôre a fairly big community on TikTok. The problem is, TikTok shadowbans us. Our content is not shown to the world, causing our hard work and efforts to go down the drain. I have to constantly keep making new accounts so people can see my content. You shouldn‚Äôt shadowban people for using the same tags over again multiple times. It makes it clear what its from, what character, what the video‚Äôs about, etc. 
I‚Äôve had to take down videos and reupload because you shadowban my account and nothing is shown to anyone. Even after reuploading, it never seems to get anywhere either. 
I spend SO much money for this and you trash it like it‚Äôs nothing. Its cruel how you do this. As much as I may hate the app for this, I still remain on it because of how happy it can make me sometimes. It gets hard to enjoy it when all you do is shadowban and delete my content. It‚Äôs unfair and disgusting. 
At least let us KNOW before you go ahead and block all of our content. Like, give us cosplayers a warning, and then we‚Äôll start using different tags, or calming down on our posts a little. We aren‚Äôt spamming the hashtag or making inappropriate tiktoks, we‚Äôre making our cosplays known. It‚Äôs insanely difficult to do that because of this, and it angers me, as well as many others, a lot. Fix your app, it‚Äôs horrible.

review:
So many of the sponsored ads are SCAMS. They‚Äôre dropshippers! Especially the Sanrio ones. Every single one of their products can be found on AliExpress! Want to how you can find out? Take a screenshot and reverse image search one AliExpress. I‚Äôve seen water bottles, sun lamps, lighters, hello kitty phones, counterfeit Sanrio products CONSTANTLY being pushed through the sponsored ads. Idk how tiktok processes their applicants for ads, but this is super ridiculous. I don‚Äôt even know if anything is done with the reports I make because I‚Äôm not foolish enough to fall for the scams, and because they don‚Äôt give updates on the ads you report. If Tiktok doesn‚Äôt come up with a better way to handle this, I can see the company in very deep trouble in the long run.

As a woman that really doesn‚Äôt want to interact with stupid children, it‚Äôs a step in the right direction to add an adults only feature. What really needs work on is the false reporting that happens that salty people make. Not that it‚Äôs happened to me, but I know people who have truly been falsely reported for ‚Äúminor safety‚Äù and ‚Äúthis is a minor.‚Äù Really, you make a video that doesn‚Äôt agree with a certain group of people, and it‚Äôs like a flock of angry Karens get unleashed on you. Come up with a better way to review reports (other than bots) because that‚Äôs what I feel really hinders anyone‚Äôs (who isn‚Äôt a kid) experience with tiktok.

title: Why I hate TikTok

review: Hi love this app so much as a content creator. It is fun, it‚Äôs easy, and the communities you create are fantastic. Also I love that there is gifting within the app. The is a but however.... There seems to be issues with TT‚Äôs reporting process. For example, I had a video reported and taken down because it ‚Äúviolated‚Äù TT‚Äôs guidelines. I‚Äôve read their guidelines twice and it does not. It also seems that you can report someone for any reason, and even if it is not true, that person can lose their ‚Äúgo live‚Äù privileges, or even a temporary ban. There should be an appeal process with TT admins and someone to speak to regarding these issues. Also, while some accounts are getting banned or having features temporarily turned off for no apparent reason, there are bully accounts growing a rapid rates. These accounts depict hate towards veterans, the disabled, age, race, religion, sexual orientation, gender, etc. it breaks my heart every time I run into these accounts and see how they mistreat the helpless. SHAME on TikTok for not having a better system to address this. I really hope I can come back and give 5 stars in the future. But for now I‚Äôm at 3.
title: Great Social Media App but....

review: I absolutely love it. There‚Äôs nothing that could ever compare. It‚Äôs hilarious and political and overall just...works. The ‚ÄúFor You‚Äù page is tailored to what you like and who you follow. The algorithm works beautifully. I honestly have no words it‚Äôs such a great app. The only time i‚Äôve ever seen it glitch was like, a week ago? And that‚Äôs pretty good, considering I‚Äôve had the app for over two years now. It keeps all of your notifications, even if you log out if your account, so you‚Äôre always protected. Honestly, even if it was stealing my information and running even when i shut the app out, I don‚Äôt care. I open my phone with my finger print. Now, most people open their phones with their faces too. Who cares?? Our information was being stolen by the government in the first place üòπüôà‚ú® Anyways, i really enjoy the app, 10/10, I‚Äôll use it until it shuts down. I‚Äôve learned more on this app than I have throughout my entire US education....and I‚Äôm a sophomore in high school. This app shares information and trends and jokes faster than Ive ever seen and I love it with my whole chest. Thank you TikTok and please never leave ü•∫‚ù§Ô∏è

title: Sooooo.

review:
I, like many others, have learned so much from this app that I hadn‚Äôt even though of, considered or even have a crap about until I downloaded this app and saw random videos on here. I love this app for so many reasons, the connections made, the lives changed so drastically by people WANTING to do good deeds, the pets saved, probably several cases solved, the LEARNING that happens because of people sharing things to teach others, I mean there is literally something for everyone here. I have seen many, many others praise this app for the same reasons, because the things you learn here can vary from a new recipe to hacks, to things about your mental and physical health, things about history, things about your government and places around the world, things about your pets, other people, other cultures‚Ä¶ so of COURSE the government wants to interfere, because it‚Äôs something they can‚Äôt make money off of or control or it‚Äôs something they didn‚Äôt think of first. 
Don‚Äôt let this app become another sad memory like MySpace. This app does so much GOOD in the world and it makes no sense to be negative about it all.
title: Don‚Äôt take away TikTok!!!

review: Tik Tok obviously is not a platform for children to be browsing on, so I don't understand what the problem is with a little bit of adult humor. There are way too many people who get offended by little things. For example, I made a video simply following a trend of doing a certain dance aggressively. Out of nowhere, a ton of people started hating in the comments for "being rude to the creator of the dance" by doing it aggressively. Then in a week or two, the video was "under review" and still has been under review for 4 weeks now. Tik Tok rarely ever responds to reports and also shadowbans way too many good content creators. These content creators are probably the reason a lot of people still use the app, so why shadowban them? They're just helping you expand your platform to multiple types of audiences. Also, the views system must be addressed. I have over 20,000 followers and a lot of my videos maintain a very high like-to-view ratio, yet they don't receive nearly as many views as one would expect that it should get. For smaller accounts, this continues to be an issue. Less views means less exposure, which thus means less followers. Tik Tok also seems to tend to give my less successful videos way too many likes, which have a horrible like:view percentage. These views should instead go to the content that people like more.

Second thing misinformation is a pretty big problem on TikTok in my opinion sure you have large creators spreading researched facts and information but then you have thousands of smaller ones that spread things that are simply ludicrous and not true but it wouldn‚Äôt be a problem if most of or at least a good portion of TikTok actually believes it (mostly kids rarely teens). But to be frank there are simply many other problems on TikTok that I can‚Äôt simply cover but overall they‚Äôre not much of a problem but show their heads once and a while but overall it‚Äôs a good app I‚Äôd recommend it if you want to be entertained or start a career in entertainment just try not to get in to hot water or fall for misinformation.

Another issue is the community guidelines and the Ai or bots used to suppress or shadow an your account and take down your videos. I have videos get taken down by TikTok‚Äôs robots and they should never have been taken down in the first place. Also Tiktok has been not allowing me and other users to pin comments. review:
My account was recently permanently banned. After going through the guidelines, nothing I posted violated community guidelines. Worse yet, the app is supposed to have an ‚Äúappeal‚Äù option and it wouldn‚Äôt show up. Contacted customer support through the only way I could find in both the app and one the website, and I still have no clear explanation as to why my account was PERMANENTLY banned and no clear way to appeal their decision. I‚Äôm incredibly disappointed because I really enjoyed TikTok and made sure my videos fell within guidelines. I posted a ‚ÄúHappy Memorial Day‚Äù video with some planes flying over from an air show, and within hours my account was taken down. Previously I posted videos of my die cast car collection, and am completely unsure how any of those would land me in ‚Äúpermanently banned‚Äù mode.

Don‚Äôt put too much effort into your account if you have one...the app developers can clearly take away all your hard work in an instant for no clear reason. If there had been a reason for the ban, I wouldn‚Äôt be leaving this review, but since I didn‚Äôt violate any guidelines to my best knowledge (and I have reviewed the guidelines to make sure), and was given no explanation, I am making sure I share my story with friends and whoever will listen so they don‚Äôt have to feel the same way I did after all my work was gone.
title: Unclear Account Suspension...

review: This is the first social platform developed around the fundamental values necessary to increase self-efficacy. The user-designed engagement is beneficial for those who seek positive influences to learn and expand their understanding of different cultures as well as personal growth. Their immediate response to requests for assistance is unprecedented compared to alternative social media platforms. While I am technologically challenged due to cognitive disabilities, I find this to be the best platform for ease of use and access and global reach. Kudos to TikTok for developing a means to increase global awareness and relationships among so many cultural dimensions. My only concern is privacy and lack of transparency in the government‚Äôs involvement in this platform. The manner in which user information is being collected raises privacy concerns. Additionally intellectual property rights/protection and plagiarism is not addressed anywhere. So while the platform is the most promising to unite and improve social wellness, it is unclear what users are giving up of their citizenship rights to receive the platform benefits. I would proceed with caution in engaging with this social platform.
title: Global Learning and Societal Well-being

review: I began 2020 uncertain of where I was headed. My dreams had come true in 2019 with a new home but, I was entering this new home alone. My Joshua had gone to Rainbow Bridge in 2015 and my loss had hit hard. I wanted my new beginning to be a healing but, it turned into more heartache, tears and loneliness. The 2020 Rona hit scared me to no end with elderly parents and my brother living with them and he may have heeded the mask wearing but, never stopped heading out to places where way too many chances of spreading the virus was possible. Going into May I began working from home which was, also, a dream come true yet, it hit me even harder. So as you can see...my life was sucking in my HEAD..Mentally I was a mess! Then came Tik Tok and I became addicted but, as it worked it‚Äôs magic I began to feel whole, again. I know I was working on myself as I listened to affirmations, laughter, with friendships developing and loneliness ending. I tried my hand at some videos and my confidence is growing again. I see 2021 as a new beginning. And I have my Tik Tok friends to thank ü•∞üíØ‚ú®And Tik Tok for being an outlet to releasing the negative and filling up my heart with the positivity.
title: 2020 Full of Sadness

review:
Tik Tok has been selective about what content they take down when reported in a way that benefits white supremacy. Currently there is an account on their platform that is putting George Floyd's face on life sized dolls and doing a number of disturbing things with the dolls. From running the dolls over with a steam roller to having the doll thrust when audio is played that says his murderer's name. This account has been reported probably hundreds of times by various other accounts (mine included) and yet the result is that Tik Tok every single time so far has determined that that type of content "doesn't violate community guidelines."

In addition to this many creators and users of the app (myself included) have noticed that white creators are routinely allowed to use the n word (content doesn't get removed when reported) while Black creators have their content removed and even their accounts suspended when they stitch this content in attempt to raise awareness and ask the white creators to stop using harmful language. BIPOC creators also get their content removed and their accounts suspended for simply talking about the discrimination they face in their every day lives. 

This app needs to stop protecting white supremacists and denying BIPOC creators the ability to speak out against issues that directly harm them.
title: Absolutely deplorable follow through on community guidelines

review:
has your child asked you to get tiktok?! 
Heres some things you should know before saying yes!
tiktok allows you to have a private or public account, public is when anybody on the app can see your videos, private is were everyone has to request to see the account or videos, if a child under the age of 13 asked to get the app, definitely make sure they make their acc private! How to do that is you go to your profile, press the three dots in the right corner of the screen, press privacy and tap the little switch next to the words‚Äùprivate acc‚Äù and there you go! I definitely recommend to make your child's account private, there are many adults on the app that may be a little to creepy. but over all the app is amazing for you child to learn new things and have a fun time!      First off, the lives. Only people over 1000 followers get to go live, which I think is ridiculous. review: TikTok used to be for the younger generation, but now there are people of all ages doing TikTok, and it is so awesome. There are funny videos, sad videos, informative videos, crazy videos, serious videos, and anything you could dream up videos. You never know what you are going to run across. I love it. It's the best media app I've run across, and there are a lot of them. Don't worry about going viral or earning money. I mean it's great if you do, but it's harder than you think and if you worry about it you are going to miss out on a lot of cool stuff. Just relax and enjoy it. You won't be sorry. Most people are so kind and if you do run across someone who isn't kind or says not so nice things, you can report them and block them. Tik Tok is what you make it. If you want it to be a fun place and want to make friends and enjoy yourself, then make it fun, make friends and enjoy‚ÄºÔ∏è I am disabled and don't get out much, and Tik Tok has been so good for me. ‚ù§Ô∏è I look forward to watching, interacting and making videos. title: Live

review: The number of creators I see talking about being shadowbanned despite breaking zero community guidelines is ridiculous. Not to mention! Most of these creators are people of color, queer, or both. The rest are allies. Anyone who speaks out in favor of the BLM movement frequently gets shot down by the apparently impartial company, despite others posting from the other side facing no consequences. It got to the point where the whole blacklivesmatter tag was blocked. They‚Äôve done this not only to the black community and allies but to any minority group, including but not limited to: indigenous peoples, Hispanic Americans, Asian Americans, the LGBT community, and the disabled community. It‚Äôs honestly disgusting that the company (and that‚Äôs what it is, a company. No decision is made by one good hearted person) claims to support these communities while simultaneously silencing them for the benefit of PR. I‚Äôm joining the Juneteenth walkout of this app, and I‚Äôm happy to do so. They need to understand that their users do have power over what happens to the app as a whole. We write their paycheck. If they want to keep saying whatever they think will calm their consumers while their actions reflect the opposite of their words, they can watch those consumers leave one by one. If they want to keep siding with the oppressor, they can face the consequences. We‚Äôre not stupid. We demand to be heard.
title: Shadow banning is out of control

review: I absolutely love tik tok. I am so addicted and so are all of my friends. However, I feel that the video review process is a bit odd. Many videos contain curse words, but curse words are counted as a violation of community guidelines when used in captions or comments. Many people post videos of them drinking and will mention in the caption that they are of legal drinking age and that they do not recommend underage drinking, yet will be penalized for it (when many other videos are not). I once posted a video that was inspired by several other videos on the app, which contained short clips of each friend of mine drinking, and then passing the drink to the next person. My video was taken down due to a violation of community guidelines, so I submit an appeal mentioning how everyone in the video was 21. It got put back up but got barely any views, so I reposted it. It got taken down immediately and they did not accept my second appeal? It does not make sense and was not fair considering they accepted my first appeal. I can see that many other people have this problem and I just wonder why they are so strict when some of these videos that violate community guidelines are actually great (and extremely popular) content.
title: Unfair community guidelines

review: I love this app. It makes me laugh, cry, and it just makes my day. I love sending videos to my friends through direct messaging. However, because of my age, I cannot do that anymore. I understand it is for the safety of younger users, but if you‚Äôre going to have a specific feature, have it be for all users. Another complaint I have is going live. Also, the (for loss of better words) ‚Äúrule‚Äù about how you must have a thousand followers to go live. There are small accounts that can‚Äôt go live for this reason. What harm will it do if you take that ‚Äúrule‚Äù off? Another thing, the one hundred character limit on comments has to go. I have replied to myself to finish a comment. I am a very opinionated person, and if I have something to say, I will say it, but most of the time it is hard due to this character quantity restriction. Another thing I have yet to be confirmed but is very believable is keeping people who aren‚Äôt of ideal beauty standards off of the For You page. That is very much messed up and should not be tolerated, and I would to see like more small accounts on the For You page. Thank you.

review: It‚Äôs a good app overall, but I have some issues with it. I feel like they aren‚Äôt considerate of all of their users. Sometimes they take down videos from ‚Äúviolations‚Äù when they are fine, but then when I report a scam of ‚ÄúYou won a free IPhone just click the link in the description‚Äù they say the video has no violations. Maybe I reported it under the wrong violation, but that kind of content needs to be removed. Then I report a fishing bot and they still say there is no violation. This is so frustrating for users who are trying to help them keep the app clean of this kind of content. I probably have too many ‚Äúfalse‚Äù reports since now it takes only a couple of minutes to tell me of there was no violation on the ‚Äúclick the link and we can start chatting‚Äù video that a bit sent me. I understand that it is hard for them to go through all the reports that get submitted each day, but at this point I feel like they may not really care about what gets reported to them. I would send them a strongly worded letter, but what‚Äôs the point feels like they would just say ‚ÄòWe are sorry you feel that way, but just block them and ignore them if it bothers you so much.‚Äô

developerResponse: {'id': 35552880, 'body': 'Thank you for taking the time to leave us this review. We appreciate you sharing your feedback with us and we will make sure to share it with our product team. We value your feedback so we can continue to improve! ', 'modified': '2023-03-23T16:11:28Z'}
review: I have learned more from rabbit hole research dives spurred from TikTok videos I‚Äôve seen, than I ever did in school. Very informative content, and the algorithm is good at helping you find community and connection. Information is shared quickly, often before it can be censored/shadow-banned. There are downsides: 1. Censorship of content related to human rights, while egregious and hateful content seems to get a pass. (No different than Facebook in that regard.) 2. Spam reporting is a bit of an issue. Even after blocking the user you disagreed with or whom was upset by you in some way, they can and will come in from anonymous other accounts they‚Äôve created to report you. 3. Not everyone can create playlists/folders, so for those that can‚Äôt, their videos end up in one long scrolling feed on their profile, like Instagram. BIPOC creators and those that post about human rights seem to get shadow-banned/spam reported, I‚Äôve heard many complaints of difficulty getting views, especially when speaking on topics around fascism, racism, sexism, homophobia, transphobia and privilege.

review:
While I have been enjoying tiktok so much there are a few things I would change.  
 1. Notification and  Deleting PMs. While it is nice to get PMs I do not want to get a PM every time I become friends with someone. And if this is not going to change you need to add a delete multiple messages option. Such as being able to select more then 1 message at a time. I have over 10k messages that I can‚Äôt not sift through to find my friends messages so becomes a pain. 
2. BanningEtiquette. While I argee with banning someone for doing something wrong I do not believe someone should be band the instant someone reports them. I think that if a live is reported someone needs to sit in the live and actually see if any guidelines are being broken and then take action. I have a mark on my tiktok because someone Falsely reported me. I got my live back after 24 hours but that is still 24 hours I could not go live for something I did not do. 
  While I really do enjoy meeting new people and being live those 2 things are extremely frustrating.  I hope to keep seeing improvements in the future.
title: Review

review:
The only reasons why I‚Äôm giving this app 2 stars is because like many have said, it is a highly addicting app, there are a lot of bug issues that just keep getting worse with every update! 
First, started when I would go to my shared videos, I would take a minute or two to open the video up. 
Then, not only did that not change with the next update, but some videos wouldn‚Äôt play and I would have to exit out of the videos I was watching and click on the one I wanted and wait a minute to load. 
NOW, with this update, not only are these two issues STILL ongoing, but NOW I can‚Äôt even look at the comments on the videos on my fyp! It says that the user has disabled comments. However, when I go to their page and look up the video and wait a few seconds for the video to load AND another few seconds to comments load, that‚Äôs when I‚Äôm able to read them. 
I really love this app and have had it since late 2017, early 2018. But these issues just keep getting worse and soon I won‚Äôt be able to tolerate it any longer! I have an iPhone 12 Pro Max if it matters and I update my phone when there are new updates available. Same with this app. I never skip out on an update. But this is unacceptable.
title: Ongoing issues with updates and no resolve.

review: They allow creators with In reasonable Guidelines . To create the videos they want and get there message across. With any app they have there pros and cons. But, I am a small time creator. And I think it‚Äôs awesome. Well infact I would have never thought of getting on the camera and talking and teaching about my passion for Motorcycle Repair as a Trained Technician. But because of tik tok. I have a platform to convey tricks tips and technology I know about to other fellow Mechanics/technicians. And in turn I learn from them. Ya know these apps don‚Äôt always have to be about shaking the booty. This app gives people a voice. If you do something that tik tok says Hey Jersey yeah we took that video down because of this. Just reply and talk to these guys like reasonable Human beings. And poof your video is back on like magic. It‚Äôs called Adulting. tik Tok has been good to me. I only have 2900 followers. But so far this app has been really good to me. Look, you can‚Äôt go wrong. What else you got to loose. And where else with in Reasonable Situations are your seriously going to be able to have your voice heard? Try it out. what is there to loose?

review: I would like the caption on Tik Tok‚Äôs to not have no character limit and not just ‚ÄúTitle can‚Äôt exceed 100 characters‚Äù this really bothers me when I‚Äôm trying to explain something, but then having to take it to the comments while it can get lost in the comments and no one knowing the purpose. I would also like to not have a limit because maybe you are trying to explain something to your fans, but not having enough in the caption and also having to take it to the comments. I really think Tik Tok can improve on the caption even though it‚Äôs only used to write something very brief, I personally think it can be turned into something where you can write a whole paragraph and not having to take it anywhere else. For example you want to explain why you have been gone for awhile on Tik Tok so you write a whole paragraph and when you post it, it shows a little part of the paragraph to make it look like a caption, and says ‚Äúread more‚Äù in a bold font or is highlighted. But overall I really think Tik Tok is a great place to share your inspiration but just not enough in the caption because some others would like to read or hear your creativity and would like to read a whole paragraph about it (in my opinion). title: Arianna Gracia

review: I have had Tiktok since its conception in late August of 2018. I have seen every trend, every audio, every personalities rise and fall and then some. I went from daily and constant use, to having restrain myself to 10 videos at a time as to not lose myself in the app. But then they started editing the algorithm, catering to your interests and likes. This causes you to be completely consumed. It gives children, teenagers, and young adults a platform like never before, finding fame almost instantaneously if you understand how the app works and youre willing to sell your soul. My problem is not with how the app functions; it does its job perfectly. No, my problem is with the creators themselves. This is a Chinese app, there is an entire side of the app we cannot see we are not allowed to see and it begs the question what is on it? Thats also not my problem. Tiktok has demonstrated multiple times that it silences certain creators, and it is constant. Black people have been silenced. In light of recent events and the importance of awareness of the BLACK LIVES MATTER movement in the U.S. and now internationally, TikTok has deleted the hashtag #blacklivesmatter and related tags in an attempt to what I can assume is silence black voices and supporters. It is tiresome and disappointing and the app along with every police department in the U.S. deserves to burn.

title: The reason I‚Äôm giving it a low rating is...

review:
Their TOS clearly states they don‚Äôt allow accounts that impersonate other users yet they don‚Äôt have a proper way to report this. The only options are ‚Äúme‚Äù and ‚Äúcelebrity‚Äù and typically if someone pretends to be an acct they are usually smart enough to block the person they‚Äôre pretending to be, so the person being taken advantage of has no way to even know their likeness is being stolen unless someone tells them. And even if they are made aware, how exactly are they supposed to report a profile they can‚Äôt see? And if they‚Äôre not a ‚Äúcelebrity‚Äù it doesn‚Äôt matter? Make it make sense. 

I made a video and called this behavior out and it was reported and removed for ‚Äúbullying and harassment‚Äù which I am absolutely not doing. There is no other way to illustrate the point besides posting the imposter‚Äôs handle, and I bet you they are on an alternate acct (one I am unaware of) and are seeing and reporting my videos that way, bc it‚Äôs like the moment I post it, they‚Äôre on me. I have received two strikes against my account just for speaking out against what is obviously NOT RIGHT!

All I‚Äôm asking for is for you to add the proper reporting menu options in order for people to be able to report a fraudulent account stealing the likeness of specific users, NOT just celebrities. Also please remove my strikes bc I did nothing wrong.
title: Don‚Äôt abide their own TOS

review: I‚Äôve been on Tik Tok for quite a long while so i‚Äôve finally decided to write a review. I love TikTok, I really do. It has a lot of fun videos, and the algorithm is amazingly accurate. Most of the people are kind. Some may argue that TikTok can be unsafe, which is true, but it‚Äôs not as bad as you think. You can report and block people, and you can also make your account private so people can‚Äôt see the videos you make and they have to request to follow you. You can comment on videos, unless the person who made the video decides to turn off comments. There‚Äôs is also an option to privately chat with people, but I‚Äôm sure you can turn that off if you want to. If someone says anything uncomfortable, you can always block them too. The reason I give it four stars is mainly just bc of my own opinion. I think that TikTok can be negative, they‚Äôll joke about anything and everything (mainly talking about gen-z) which can be tiring and not very nice if they‚Äôre making fun of personalities or looks. TikTok is also very addicting and can ruin your attention span, so do yourself a favor and SET A TIME LIMIT. In conclusion, you should get the app, just please be careful.

title: I recommend it

review: If I could give tik tok zero stars, I would. I deleted this app over a year ago due to its unjust policies and blatant support of racist language, content, and content creators. However, seeing black creators (I hope using the word black isn‚Äôt considered inappropriate on this review like it is on the app itself) being used, not being paid equally, and shadow banned for speaking HISTORICAL truths is why I decided to write this review. It‚Äôs disheartening how boldly this app supports racism all while non people of color are taking content from black (oops) I mean, melanated folks content without crediting them. I‚Äôve seen more melanated creators endure more mistreatment from an app that without tik tok dances, no one would know what to do with themselves. I find it interesting the terms ‚Äúwhite power‚Äù and ‚Äúwhite supremacy‚Äù can just be typed freely but the term ‚Äúblack success‚Äù is flagged as ‚Äúinappropriate‚Äù. We get it. You don‚Äôt want black people to be successful unless your hands are dug in them for money. It‚Äôs how the country was built anyway. Remember, karma is real and you won‚Äôt stay on top forever. MySpace and Vine died off too. Only difference is, Tik Tok only values anyone who isn‚Äôt black and those that will lie to appease those with fragile egos. Thanks for genuinely being terrible and I hope anyone with a hand in this atrocity of an app can do better. Love and light.

review:
hi! ive been using tiktok daily for a few months now as a creator, and ive noticed a few problems.
firstly, i have about 2,800 followers. all of a sudden kids who look to be 7-10 (for SURE not the minimum age of 13!) are following me more than anyone my age (18.) i cosplay so i dont know if its because they see a cool costume or smthn and just follow, but i dont make content for children and removing child follower after child follower is really stressful! i even have 13+ in my bio :( please try to make sure there are only 13+ ppl on ur app. i understand a lot of it is also the parents fault, but maybe theres smthn u could do :/
also, shadowbanning and randomly deleted videos is a huge issue, especially now that BLM is on the rise. if tiktok really supports BLM, then why do my tiktoks on the topic get significantly less views/likes than all of my cosplay videos, even when my followers support the movement too? and i rarely use tags so i should have the same reach as always. please try to focus more on banning people who are spreading hate instead of the people who are working for positivity.
other than these (annoying) issues, i adore this app!! ive made so many friends on it. there are ao many different sides to tiktok, youll for sure find your niche.

review:
TikTok. This is a great app! And I even find myself obsessive, very very obsessive. The app is just too hard to get off of, it‚Äôs addicting! 
  My problem is, I‚Äôve been hacked. I‚Äôve reported my problems several times to you leaving my phone number to get contacted anytime. I haven‚Äôt got any type of response, any text, etc. I really do enjoy this app, but I would like to keep up with trends and make different accounts. I‚Äôve worked super hard for my 2500+ fans, and I would really like to keep them! 
  Also, I feel as if my app is draining a lot of my battery as well as taking up a lot of my storage. I‚Äôve had to offload a TikTok a few times and so has my phone on its own. So basically because of this problem, I only have about two apps and about 68 pictures. I am factory restoring my phone this weekend, but I don‚Äôt want to lose my whole Tik Tok account! I‚Äôve asked more than several people to use their phone numbers that they haven‚Äôt used already, for Tik Tok. I also think the idea of that only using a phone number once, isn‚Äôt a very good one. Once you use your phone number, you have to use a different one! I hope you understand!- @.briannaysabel
title: Not responding to reported problems!

review:
I don‚Äôt know if it‚Äôs a poorly developed and myopic moderation AI, obtuse moderators that don‚Äôt take context into consideration at all, or both. Their moderators appear to only see explicit racial, gendered, and homophobic slurs as offensive. No recognition or consideration of dogwhistles, hate symbols, innuendo, or plausible deniability. When making reports, there isn‚Äôt even space for users to provide that context. Bad UI decision, especially in this day and age. Even Twitter, with its terrible track record for moderation, at least offers that.

Things are only taken down when they are mass reported. Anything even slightly linguistically coded is immediately rebuffed and allowed to continue on the platform. Even if it is extremely violent, sexual, gruesome, or otherwise inappropriate. Cults that share hateful or deliberately misleading information are allowed to thrive. I would never let my kids on here and be exposed to that. It‚Äôs reprehensible that TikTok corporate isn‚Äôt doing more to manage this major problem.

All of this boils down to truly one of the worst out there that I‚Äôve encountered when it comes to content moderation, and the bar is incredibly low. This totally ruins the user experience of what is otherwise a generally enjoyable and entertaining content platform.
title: Awful content moderation

review: I love TikTok but there‚Äôs a big problem with the app they don‚Äôt show black creators love and they always delete our post when we talk about racial profiling or when we talk about black history and how black lives matter. Whenever I make a video about black history and racism I get shadow banned, my video is ‚Äúunder review‚Äù, or taken down. I find that disrespectful because even though I don‚Äôt have a big following I can still educate people on black lives but TikTok won‚Äôt let black creators do so. title: Wow

review: I've tried to give TikTok a shot at being on my phone, and after a couple of weeks i found myself endlessly scrolling through whatever was recommended to me, and i took it of my phone because i realized that scrolling through this app makes time fly by, time that is VERY limited to one's life. The more you spend on this app the more you waste that precious time, doing other things that could be worth it. I've taken a step to stop being addicted to Social Media, but others haven't. Everyone has social media so much that it's essential to life, making friends, and just talking. I understand that deleting your social medias practically cut off all of things, but if you do, you just might find something that can be worth your time or change your life for the better. If it's taking the time to study for an exam needed to graduate, or spending time with your friends or family, it doesn't matter what you do as long as it's worth your time. You've probably heard this in another way, such as "get off the phone and go do something", but you've never had a reason as to why you should, until now. So if you're reading this, Find something worth your while, and even delete this app. After all, You might just benefit from doing so.

title: Stop adding and pushing features nobody wants

review: What could I possibly know about a multi billion dollar app right? Take my words with a grain of salt and do your own research. At this point tiktok makes you pay for exposure. Good content isnt enough anymore to develop a following making it harder for people without money to grow. Its practically impossible to reach 1k  followers without spending money. It cost me over 100US Dollars just to get my brand name out there and it left me with 240 ish followers. My personal account used to get thousands of views including positive engagement. If I can make good content consistently and grow organically less than a year ago. Then its only safe to assume that tik tok is drowning out the free users now. I understand they have to make money but they were doing fine beforehand and it seems like they have just got greedy ever since the promote feature became a thing. Small businesses and new startups resort to social media for growth and it used to be a good tool for people just starting out making original content. Being original and interesting isnt enough now.. the standard is ‚Äúpay for view‚Äù now unless you already had a large following before the change.

review: I LOVE this app so much but there is one major problem that needs to be addressed, the bugs. I‚Äôm not sure if this actually is a bug but it‚Äôs still something that needs to be worked on, the algorithm. The TikTok algorithm is very weird and glitchy... I‚Äôm not sure if it was meant to be like this but it seems that only people who are straight, white, skinny, and do weird ‚Äútrendy‚Äù dances can get on the fyp (for you page). It is also very hard to gain followers because of this. The algorithm tends to really ignore creators that fall into the LGBTQ category, liberal category, cosplay category, anime category, or if you are just a poc who speaks out about the injustices in the world. TikTok algorithm will do something that is called shadow banning to creators if they aren‚Äôt ‚Äútrendy‚Äù and since it is very difficult to get on the fyp this happens to a lot of people. There are also things to talk about such as the actual bugs like when TikTok will randomly break for no reason, when you lose followers that didn‚Äôt actually unfollow you, and when you don‚Äôt get notifications when you should be. These are just a few things that have happened so far and I STRONGLY urge TikTok to try and fix these problems before they lose a whole bunch of people.

title: TikTok is sketchy..and not in a good way

review: I love this app! I was using it and it is super easy and fun to use. It took me literally 2 minutes to sign up and get my profile ready. It showed me how to scroll and like and all these other things to get me started! It is such a good app and I love how everyone can share ideas. One question though; why can't people without a lot of followers get discovered as much? They might take like, 2 hours making a video and doing their best quality and posting it with tags and all that, yet they still only may get 5 likes and it would take a long time to get more followers and be discovered. Lots of people who are popular on tiktok have it easy because they post a new video and so many people follow them that it instantly goes viral and all those other good videos made by people who haven't had a lot of followers yet get drowned out. That annoys me, but I won't complain too much. It could take years to get popular or could take months. Overall, this is a great app and I love it! The user interface is super clean and easy to access/use. Will keep this for a long time!

It has it‚Äôs ups and downs and I feel that if you provide proof like your drivers license you should be verified because that is the only thing that I don‚Äôt like about the app because it causes people to not feel valued as much as others. Just make it where people that provide you a driver‚Äôs license or a state ID or some kind of legal document that they are who they say they are get them verified because it should not be a competition to prove that you are a real person or matter about the amount of followers you have to prove who you are. title: TikTok saved my life

review: The reason why I‚Äôm giving TikTok a one star review is because it‚Äôs very addicting first of all it takes over your life and keeps you in your own little bubble for hours, and hours from just scrolling on a screen. My older sisters can scroll on TikTok for hours, and is very unhealthy for her eyes. My best friend, me and my twin sister all made a promise that we would never get TikTok but soon enough I got it I only got it for the memes, but I told somebody in that person told my best friend and that‚Äôs when she got it and it took over her life. It‚Äôs almost like we‚Äôre invisible around her because she‚Äôs so addicted to popularity and followers. Every time I go over to my best friend‚Äôs house she‚Äôs always on it and it‚Äôs almost like she‚Äôs ignoring us that she always wants to do TikTok with her. This is why I am writing a one star review to TikTok. Number one it is taking over my family‚Äôs life and friends. Number two he can keep you in your room or in your own little bubble for hours, and hours scrolling on a screen. Number three. If people were to go on TikTok, I‚Äôll think that TikTok should put reminders on their screens to take a break or a timer until you get to go back on TikTok. So yes, these are all my reasons why I think that TikTok is a bad app to have on your phone or any device.

I gave it three stars because of the reporting situation and the type of content tiktok is allowed to exist and what content they are not. There are videos of grown men making comments on teenagers bodies, but nothing is done. There‚Äôs bullying and trolling in the comment sections. Those don‚Äôt go away, no. It‚Äôs a creator that makes genuinely good content getting banned for being accused of being underaged, even after he proves he was in fact old enough to be on the app putting out the content that he was. You have content creators getting banned because of the type of LANGUAGE they use, as if there‚Äôs not a way to warn a user that a video has content they may not want to see or hear. However, there is a feature like that already. That‚Äôs the type of content being censored or taken down. Not the more damaging content but content that ultimately wouldn‚Äôt be different either way you put it. Despite clicking "not interested" on these videos that keep appearing out of nowhere, the tiktok fyp keeps flooding me with popular videos that have nothing to do with my interests like hair tips and dancing videos. There's nothing wrong with videos like these being on tiktok but it's frustrating to see them show up over and over when I've never liked any videos that would push this content onto my fyp so much. It's gotten to the point where I've actually just closed out the app after a few minutes and went onto other video sharing apps just so I can see more content like I actually want to see. I'm not sure what caused such an abrupt change in the tiktok algorithm, but I'd rather see videos pertaining to my interests similar to ones I've liked even if they aren't popular as opposed to popular videos that I don't really care about :(

review: I absolutely love tiktok. It is so addicting and if you‚Äôre following users that post the content you like, it is probably the most entertaining app out there. As much as I love this app, there are also frustrating aspects of it. If you ever have a problem on tiktok and send them questions regarding it, don‚Äôt expect a response. Tiktok is terrible with responding to issues. My account has recently been blocked from posting for a week because I broke community guidelines, which is fine and I understand that, however - when I got it back after a week, I posted three videos in one day, none of which were a threat to the community guidelines whatsoever, and that same day I got blocked again! I have tried reaching out to them through the apps ‚Äúreport and issue ‚Äú section, email, and even Instagram! They have never gotten back to me and my account remains blocked. I take my account seriously as well as I have a good amount of followings. Tiktok, please resolve this issue of removing videos that aren‚Äôt inappropriate or blocking accounts that are innocent.
title: Fun but frustrating

review: The USA badly needed laws around data sharing long before TikTok came along, but since TikTok we‚Äôve had the first time Americans have actually talked in our entire history. Now, of all times, we need TikTok. My country faces civil unrest that won‚Äôt be solved without meaningful discourse. The way TikTok encourages people to have discussions about nuanced subjects on everything from personal growth to national politics with their own voices is revolutionary to our way of understanding ourselves and each other. Sure it comes with the pitfalls of social media - but I didn‚Äôt see Congress give half this energy to Facebook post-Cambridge Analytica. TikTok has personally changed my life, connected me with community like I‚Äôve never had before, and given me more focused purpose, and incidentally taken my business to the next level.   I‚Äôve had discussions and reached understandings with people of opposing political views like I never thought possible. Not only should you download this app, US citizens should write their representatives about why you should be allowed to continue to do so.
title: America needs Tiktok

review: So first I would like to say I really do love the app for many reasons, but there are also many reasons why it is becoming my least favorite app now. One reason being, is that when anyone reports a video, even for no reason at all where it is not breaking community guidelines, the app does not allow it to be visible on your profile and is ‚Äúunder review‚Äù. One of mine was supposedly reported even though it did not break any community guidelines (and I read the full rules in fine print for the app) and it has been hidden from my profile to everyone for months. This happens on lives as well, if someone reports it the app automatically makes the live stop, even if it did not break any community guidelines. If someone wants to report a video, the video should be visible until deemed otherwise if it is in fact breaking any rules, then it should be deleted. Many users work hard for their content and they shouldn‚Äôt be punished for the small percentage of people who report any random content for whatever pleasure it brings them if it doesn‚Äôt break any guidelines. The app should also notify the user if their video was reported and is under review with factual evidence on why it is under review so the user can learn from it for next time, or if it is a mistake, can be resolved. And that is why I am rating it 1 star as of this time.
title: Disappointing

review: This app is a great way to find funny/cool content. I would give TikTok 5 stars if I wouldn‚Äôt have had as many issues with my account. review: Through tiktok I genuinely found myself as a person. I was bad at expressing who I was and I struggled with my sexuality but a lot of people on tiktok showed me being different is amazing. I found who I was and was told to stand for what‚Äôs right because of this app. I‚Äôve also gotten out of dangerous scenarios because of the education on this app. I‚Äôve learned so many things about myself and life and I just can‚Äôt believe the only thing that‚Äôs been keeping me and a lot of other people in the US sane is going away forever. I‚Äôve been in horrible mental states before and every time I opened tiktok I laughed and I didn‚Äôt have to worry about anything just for a minute. I‚Äôm going to genuinely miss this app, I‚Äôm going to miss the POVs I‚Äôm going to miss the stupid dances, I‚Äôm going to miss the beautiful alt girls, I‚Äôm going to miss the people standing up for Black Lives, I‚Äôm going to miss the times where I felt like tiktok was my only family, I‚Äôm going to miss musically and the horrible but hilarious lip syncs and hand movements. Thank you for making this app, it‚Äôs one of the only good things I had left.
title: Family

review:
I rate tiktok a 5/5 personally and here‚Äôs why. To start off when you make an acc it asks you what your interested in. Everything you select will be on your fyp (for you page). If you want to follow people there‚Äôs also a following page, there you can see everyone you follows videos.

When you make an account you have the option to make it public or private. If you have it public ANYONE can see your vids. If you have it private people would have to request you to see your vids. You can also put your vids on friends only (people who follow you and you follow them back) or private (only visible to you). Also if you have a video you like but don‚Äôt want to post you can keep it in your drafts. 

I don‚Äôt recommend this app for kids 10 and under and here‚Äôs why. There is some inappropriate videos but you can simply click ‚Äúnot interested‚Äù and you won‚Äôt see videos like that anymore. There‚Äôs also cuss words but there‚Äôs some audios that the cuss words are blurred out. It‚Äôs a very fun app and I really recommend it. That‚Äôs why I would rate it 5/5.
title: My review

review: I had an account on TikTok pretty much since they switched the name to Tiktok I had a lot of good memories with friends that I no longer have and I was permanently banned and now the memories I had with my friends are gone forever and I am unaware of why I never got any warnings or anything and I had never had any strikes and I had never been temporarily banned I made a 911 memorial video and it got flagged. That was the first time anything of mine had got flagged and apparently it got me permanently banned seems a bit unfair especially since as long as I‚Äôve had this app, I only had one video flagged I think some of the employees at TikTok are very one-sided two things, even if you aren‚Äôt breaking the guidelines they will ban you if they disagree with your opinions because I spread my opinion a lot, but without breaking the guidelines nor being told to stop it made me pretty upset that I lost the memories I had on my TikTok I just wish the employees at TikTok would be more fair instead of banning people they don‚Äôt agree with and then letting people who do break the Guidelines go without repercussion as long as they agree with them. this is simply just my speculation on what I think happened could be wrong, but I seriously never got any warning whatsoever.
