title: Love TikTok but the drafts NEED to be addressed!

review:
I had a viral video that was removed for violating community guidelines. The appeal was lost with no chance to voice my side. I have spent hundreds of hours and thousands upon thousands of rounds as well as acted in an armor capacity. I have the training and expertise to educate almost anything firearms related. The terms specifically say that educational videos voiced by experts have an exception to this rule. I had no opportunity to voice or prove my experience and was notified I had revived a strike to my account and was threatened with restrictions. The video in question was an educational video regarding the size and history of three different rounds. These rounds were simulation training aids, meaning they are not real. 

Ammunition is able to be ordered and shipped to your door so the item isn‚Äôt even regulated in the same aspects as a firearm, and the rounds were fake training aids. Nothing violated the terms and conditions, I‚Äôll remove this once my video is restored, if it‚Äôs not my calls to representatives will state we are seeming the same suppression of freedom of speech as Meta,  and we should take steps to ban it as it is suppressing views that differs from the mainstream inspire of the videos not being in violations of their rules.

review: I do love TikTok but there are several items that need to be addressed to improve the app. Minor issue number one, when I go to my Favorites and search for a specific creator, the search often does not work but if I scroll through the several hundred people I am following, I can manually locate them, please fix this. Second minor issue, sometimes I accidentally refresh the feed and lose track of where I am and miss out on videos, I feel the refresh could be handled differently. Finally, and this is a big one, TikTok needs to get their AI under control and start being more consistent with their banning. There are people actually threatening creators and they are not being banned, there are people who are reporting content because they don‚Äôt like it and getting creators banned, there is content being reported that TikTok states ‚Äúviolates guidelines‚Äù when it does not. TikTok, you‚Äôve got serious work to do. You need to ban creators who put out actual aggressive/misogynistic/rapey content and ban people who repeatedly report content that doesn‚Äôt actually violate guidelines!

review:
I have had tiktok for about a year now, but I‚Äôve been noticing some things. It‚Äôs like, if someone reports someone they don‚Äôt like, or an innocent creator, they just get banned. I also have heard that tiktok bans people if they gain followers to fast. Like, I know what you‚Äôre thinking; ‚Äúthey are buying followers‚Äù but I think that you should just let people go viral without banning them. I figured that‚Äôs why my last account got banned, because all I was posting is some of my digital art for people. title: Awesome app but be careful

review: This app has the potential to be something truly amazing but has so many issues. It's main one being that it favors certain creators over others and pushes a certain kind of content or narrative to its users. It's a great app for creators and can be a very helpful tool for some if it weren't for the fact that in suppresses the majority of their content. It's become increasingly harder to get any views or interactions, and when people do follow you, they don't get shown any of the content these people are creating. It shadowbans people and takes down content that is usually wrongfully deemed "inappropriate" in some way and it's nearly impossible to submit an appeal to have it republished. I've been on this app for almost 4 years and I have a decent following but hardly any interaction because my content isn't being seen by the people who follow and isn't being put on the for you page. Not to mention it takes down harmless videos but allows dangerous, inappropriate, racist, homophobic and just generally harmful videos to stay up. With every update it gets worse and worse and there seems to be no end to the growing list of issues. You really need to do better tik tok

The app barely has any good content to offer, and almost all of it is some angsty teen who thinks they‚Äôre doing something funny but in reality it just makes people want to grab a knife and stab themselves. Enter TikTok challenges, where you try something that you think would be cool, and then you gather all your friends, you do it, and you feel pretty cool to be doing it, but then, after a few seconds, you realize that one person moves out of place or does something wrong. Oh yeah, this app is also stealing literally all your data, and is probably sending it to the Chinese Communist Party.

Well, that‚Äôs all she wrote for me. Bye, and farewell to this toxic app.

title: Age rating?

review: ‚ÄúCommunication is merely an exchange of information, but connection is an exchange of our humanity.‚Äù ‚ÄúEverything you do has an impact. Who you are ‚Äì that you are ‚Äì actually matters. In an interconnected world (the only kind we have), our actions and the actions of others are inextricably linked- we are always and forever in a dance of mutual influence with those with whom we directly and indirectly participate. It is the unavoidable reality of being social creatures, only magnified by an ever-increasingly complex and interwoven societal structure. We matter to each other.‚Äù ‚ÄúThink back to the most important experiences of your life, the highest highs, the greatest victories, the most daunting obstacles overcome. How many happened to you alone? I bet there are very few. When you understand that being connected to others is one of life‚Äôs greatest joys, you realize that life‚Äôs best comes when you initiate and invest in solid relationships.‚Äù All my World/universe üíåüåéCiao üëãüèª
title: Connecting with the world üíå Love my universe ü™ê

review:
First of all, TikTok is highly entertaining and an excellent creative outlet. Don't get me wrong, I love this app. But you, the developers, need to improve your algorithm and customer service. People have repeatedly had some of their videos banned for "violating community guidelines", and their appeals have been ignored. I am one of those people. Two of my videos were taken down despite having nothing explicit in them, and what's worse: Other users who post much more inappropriate things are completely untouched. I reported a guy for making unsettling pov's of a teacher flirting with a student, but he's fine. Meanwhile, my video condemning sexism in a particular audio that stated "Kill all men" was taken down. Plot twist: The audio is still available and people are still using it without consequence. 

Other users including (but not limited to) Onlyjayus, Cutiethiccums, and ElisTK have had similar issues. Please, fix your algorithm or at least be consistent. It's really quite infuriating. ElisTK quit using TikTok as a result, so if you don't improve you'll continue to lose users.

review: I was admittedly a little uneasy about the ‚Äúalgorithm‚Äù that determines content...heard a lot of fear-mongering about tictoc methodology before deciding to check it out myself. Does tictoc utilize various inputs to create your custom feed? Yes, and unlike most of the apps you already have, tictoc is very transparent about this feature. One thing we‚Äôve all learned from the covid madness is that data from our devices is constantly being mined or utilized by various entities, even when you think you‚Äôve ‚Äòturned off‚Äô all permissions. Tic toc is different in that it openly informs users about how they tap into data (as well as your preferences noted while on the app) to create an awesome endless array of content that is truly customizable to the user.  An unexpected feature for me is the access to information and videos that you‚Äôll never see in mainstream media. Only downside of this app is that it‚Äôs a bit addicting but they have actually taken steps to remind users that they‚Äôve been watching a while. Great app.

title: Lady Jo

review:
As a common sewer dwelling gutter rat, I do have some specific and refined tastes. I not only search the streets at night for delicacies among the trash left behind by wasteful humans, but I also indulge in food for the heart. And the best food for the heart is laughter. Tis not always the best, of course you have your unforgettable moments, but you also have the unforgivable/unfortunate ones. It‚Äôs a refreshing slice of information ranging from 3 seconds to 10 whole minutes for some reason. I‚Äôve been watched whole movies in under a minute, and in several parts reaching heights of even 120 parts! Ive even learned things I can take back to ask my lawyer Tommy, who is not a rat, but a rather large weasel. 
   All in all It‚Äôs astounding what one can do with a camera. And before you ask I do not know Remy, I wasn‚Äôt fortunate enough to arrive in Paris. I have found myself in the Americas Deep South so I do tend to be wary of loose drugs and rabid dogs off the leash, but mostly it‚Äôs nice!

review: I wouldn‚Äôt be where I am in my recovery without TikTok. I‚Äôve built a supportive community on here of amazing people trying to do good in the world. I‚Äôve seen people being saved, I‚Äôve seen people diagnosing illnesses that their doctor couldn‚Äôt, I‚Äôve seen people recover like myself, I‚Äôve seen people find love, and have families on this app, I‚Äôve seen small businesses being saved, I‚Äôve seen missing children be found because of this app, I‚Äôve seen people on the brink of unaliving themselves get the help they need because of this app. I‚Äôve seen justice happen over and over, we‚Äôve been able to reach each other from across the world, advocate, and support each other. This app has given us a voice when we didn‚Äôt have one before, And allows stories that normally wouldn‚Äôt have gotten heard to get justice. Please don‚Äôt let them take it away, they are trying to censor us and gain control back when all they are doing is hurting us.
title: This app is life-changing

review: I just want to give TikTok the Nobel Peace Prize in the Technology Division for saving the day in the time of global pandemic. They were pivotal in keeping the mind of the American public off the things that should be driving them crazy. It took shape as a mass-hypnosis-like technique, that I credit for making a bearable situation out of an otherwise unbearable situation. It connected us from our living rooms in a way that got us moving in place. It let us say, ‚Äúhey that looks like fun‚Äù, ‚ÄúI think I could do something like that‚Äù. And let people showcase themselves in their home, and therefore feel more comfortable showcasing themselves more intimately. It connected ‚Äúold folks‚Äù, who otherwise may have only used Facebook, with the younger generations who stay on the cutting edge. After all kids were spending a lot more time with grandma and grandpa in these ‚Äúpandemic‚Äù times as well, for various reasons. Social media at large saved the day. But TikTok did it with style. üòÇüëçüèæüëçüèæüèÜüôèüèæ

title: Concern

review: I have been on the app for a while now and I have noticed the amount of bullying increase dramatically in the past few months. Whether it is in the comment section or in a duet/reaction video, the amount of bullying on this app is atrocious. There are a few things that i have noticed that are aiding in this. First, an individual who is being bashed on the app, if they duet or react to the video to defend themselves, their reaction is commonly taken down and not the original video where the bashing occurs. This silences select people, which is wrong. Secondly, videos that are taken down that violate community guidelines, usually the sound is not taken down with it. There are many videos that i have seen where something offensive is being stated and the original video is nowhere to be seen. There are just copycat creators using it. There are younger members of the tik tok ‚Äúcommunity‚Äù the bullying i have seen can cause real issues. I understand there are protections for speech and the internet is hard to regulate, the company can do more to ensure that their users are in a position to be able to speak up for themselves.
title: Good app, lots of bullying

Also, it really triggers people, including me, how when you want to share a video you have to explain why, it‚Äôs not like your going to check what we said and compare to see if it matches the video. And last but not least, I liked it when everybody was happy, there was no hype or a house full of ‚Äúfamous‚Äù kids. I just liked it when you didn‚Äôt have to to be someone. Like in the summer where we could do whatever and people didn‚Äôt really care about what you wore, or did, or said. That‚Äôs all. I hope everyone who has TikTok does their part in making a nice environment for others. Thank you for reading this far!
title: My review, thoughts and things to share for TikTok:

review:
I only recently downloaded the app, so forgive me of these were features that you all decided to do away with or if they are features you have but I can‚Äôt find/haven‚Äôt noticed, but...

title: Great app, but...

review: I love that you get to express yourself my making videos, tiktok nows, or just posting a picture on a story. In TikTok settings you have the option to make your account public or private if you are not comfortable having strangers or people you don‚Äôt know see your videos. People might think it‚Äôs useless just watching people dance, sing, make you laugh, review makeup products, etc‚Ä¢ but 50% of the time it‚Äôs educational. The other day I just learned about the Titanic on TikTok and now I‚Äôm a Titanic expert! If I just need a good laugh I can always just open up TikTok and watch some funny, relatable videos! On TikTok you don‚Äôt have to keep scrolling to find a specific video, you can use the search bar to enter someone else‚Äôs user name or insert something you want to watch/learn. For example, I could search up James Charles or Titanic and videos about them or including them. Overall TikTok is a great platform to entertain, relax, or inform you. I love TikTok!

review:
Tik Tok is a really great app. It has a big variety of things you do from baking to sports to dancing and singing but I do not recommend this for people under 11. Tik Tok is very addicting and their is a lot of hate spread on videos. There is also some content and sounds on Tik Tok that are not appropriate.
 However, a child can get a private account that shields them from most of this and they can tell Tik Tok when they are uncomfortable when seeing or hearing something. On the other hand there are also many kind, uplifting and positive videos on Tik Tok.  I believe that if handled appropriately, Tik Tok is a great app to have for a tween-teen kid because of the education and lessons communicated through teachers and news Chanels on this app. Not only this, but Tik Tok can also teach stress reliving technics and help with ones stress. Videos also encourage body positivity, work efficiency, gratefulness, and respect through videos that kids and even adults love. A great way to share experiences and contact friends.

I don‚Äôt think anyone does. And I know it will be several months before we find an entirely new platform, even if it‚Äôs one that starts out with the same attention that TikTok got in October 2018. God I love this community. This never deserved to happened. At least not this soon. I‚Äôve met amazing new friends, and even a couple partners from here. I loved all the experience I‚Äôve gotten in my life from them. Now, by November 12th, everything will be gone. Only the saved videos you have on your phone and all the meme compilations will remain. Let‚Äôs take what time we have left to show each other what this platform really means. Here‚Äôs to the future.

title: My account

review: Let me start off by saying, that I absolutely love this app. I have about 70k followers and enjoy talking to my fans! But here‚Äôs the issue, twice in the last 5 days my account has been suspended due to ‚Äúbreaking community guidelines‚Äù. The first time I was talking about a charity event that I was going to live stream the next day (and because of the suspension I was unable to do so). The second time we were talking about mental health and where to find help and talking some followers through some stuff. Both very positive things. Yet both times I was cut short by an unexpected suspension. I love the app, I make money, and I make TikTok money. So constant suspensions are costing both of us money as well as making my fans upset with the app. I‚Äôve printed the community guidelines and have read from cover to cover and no where in my lives have I even come close to breaking these rules. I even boot out people who comment rude or bullying comments. I need to get this problem fixed. I‚Äôve sent emails multiple times and I never get a response. Please help me fix this before me and my fans go elsewhere. Thanks!
title: Amazing app....but not consistent

review: Without Tiktok , my life is as mundane as overcooked spaghetti. Her friends and family have already sat me down for an intervention. I ran out of the house and down to my local Starbucks to hide out from them, and immediately got on my laptop to create more videos for TikTok. In fact the other day, I started to mirror the app. I pause mid conversation now, and wait for people to double tap me just to continue. And yes, I‚Äôll admit it, I did quit my job. Why? So I can dedicate myself full-time to the art of the 62nd masterpiece. Even in my dreams, my REM cycle‚Äôs have turned into REEL cycles. My reality is now measured in likes and comments. I basically eat, sleep, and tick-tock. Breakfast? It‚Äôs a 15 minute break between scrolling sessions. Dinners? They have now become candlelit affairs as I serenade my phone screen with dreams of trending. If anyone asks me, how dedicated are you to TikTok, my reply is ‚Äúif there was a level beyond obsession‚Ä¶..‚Äù #tiktokforever #tiktokfunnies

review: If someone would have told me I‚Äôd be using tiktok to build community within my profession as a Teacher, I‚Äôd have laughed at them - but then the pandemic happened and suddenly it was my only connection to other professionals outside of my own circle of influence. With the addition of recent monetization programs, such as creativity, beta and TikTok shop, I have been able to supplement my teaching income and health make our family life a little more comfortable. I enjoy tiktok and all it has to offer. Do I understand the elusive algorithm and how it functions? No‚Ä¶but my degree is in English not computer programming. It is frustrating that there are multiple people who steal content and repost, and there is little to no way to get it removed - but I‚Äôve learned that things go in waves. The most important part is that I‚Äôm enjoying the app, I like making videos, I‚Äôve met some great friends. Plus, it‚Äôs super fun to use my follower count against my students ;)

review: While this app does indeed have a lot of good to offer, it is also a VERY toxic platform. I have gained many followers thanks to TikTok, but in the end this app is a huge time waster because of how addictive it can be. The fyp is highly intelligent and somehow knows EXACTLY what to show you that will gain your attention. This causes endless scrolling for those who have trouble putting the screen down. TikTok makes me very uncomfortable too sometimes. It almost feels like a trap. Sometimes I will be thinking about things that I haven‚Äôt really spoken about during the day, and then TikTok will customize my fyp based on those little things that I‚Äôve been thinking about. It FREAKS ME OUT. My phone is off most of the time, but it‚Äôs always listening, and I hate that. This App is an invasion of our privacy. But then again, all phones are listening; even without the TikTok app. We‚Äôve known that for years. It‚Äôs insane though, because even after typing all of this, I can‚Äôt bring myself to delete the app, because of how it‚Äôs become a huge part of my life. In conclusion, please don‚Äôt download TikTok. It will most likely change your life for the worst, especially if you struggle with self control.

review:
Overall community and performance solid. No complaints on that part. That‚Äôs the only reason it gets two stars. But the login system is absolutely horrible. I recently deleted the app, and when I redownloaded it, it didn‚Äôt even let me into my account. I typed in my password and it didn‚Äôt work and when I tried using my phone number/email to recover it, it either didn‚Äôt work or took me to junk/old accounts. After LOTS of frustration trying to get my accounts back, I decided to move on and just made a new account. When I logged out of my old account it signed me into, it logged me out of ALL my accounts including my new ones, and even when I typed the password for my new account, it didn‚Äôt work. Are you serious?

Not to mention, when I tried to get back onto my main account, it said my instagram account wasn‚Äôt linked to my TikTok account, however when I checked, it was clearly attached. Submitting appeals has done nothing for me. The app is very distracting anyway.

If you make an account and grow a big platform, pray that you don‚Äôt get logged out. That‚Äôs all I have to say.

I‚Äôve noticed that tiktok likes to boost videos of people posting hateful content. If someone speaks out against those videos or this issues surrounding the videos, their video either gets no views because of tiktok‚Äôs ‚Äúalgorithm‚Äù, or they get their video removed for hate speech. 

My bio was erased by tiktok and I was banned from changing it because ‚ÄúI violated multiple community guidelines.‚Äù However my bio was just my pronouns, so how have I violated anything? Tiktok also did the same for my second account, which didn‚Äôt even have anything in the bio. Tik tok has yet to inform me on what guidelines I broke and on the hate speech I committed. But tiktok lets these transphobic people have ‚Äúnor/mal‚Äù or ‚Äúsuper straight‚Äù in their bios. There is a huge problem regarding TikTok promoting hateful people and bringing down the people that speak out against it. TikTok needs to change.

review: I love the app, there are just some things I would suggest adding. When you‚Äôre adding effects like slo-mo or visual stuff, you have to time it perfectly when you press the button. I‚Äôd love it if you could add the feature and then move it along the timeline of the video to place it exactly where you want it. Then you should be able to make the effect longer or shorter by pinching your fingers or some other mechanic like that. The other thing would be when you‚Äôre adding the same effect but in different places of the video, the loop for the effect should reset. I did this with one of my videos (adding the same effect in different parts of the video) and I couldn‚Äôt time it perfectly and the end of one loop of an effect tagged onto part of the video and made it look like it used the effect twice. It just looked awkward. Either that, or put how long one loop for an effect is. I messed around with trying to see if any of what I just said actually was implemented but I didn‚Äôt figure it out. Other than that, keep up the good work :3

review: You punished me recently for some comments I made in response to another user‚Äôs comments. I am 61 years old and Jewish and a devout Republican. The other user was not. When you punish me and not him or her, it tells me that you are choosing sides, which makes you biased ‚Äî not neutral. It was the other user‚Äôs partisan comments that provoked mine. If you are going to punish me, then punish the other user who goaded me into making my comments. Other than that, I love your service. I make a lot of positive comments too ‚Äî more than negative comments ‚Äî but for some reason, you just home in on my negative comments. Why don‚Äôt you give me credit for all the positive comments that I contribute to your service, which far outnumber my negative comments? Better yet, quit judging my comments altogether. Unless you are Jesus Christ, then you are flawed like me, and so is your judgment. Thank you for reading my review. Sincerely, Bradley Kaufman, Morristown, Tennessee
title: Stop censoring my comments.

review: I was reluctant to join this app. It seemed invasive and full of stranger danger. But after a while I found myself truly enjoying myself while interacting with those strangers. Some of them have become valued friends. I like editing together my silly videos and looking back at where it all started until now. I enjoy watching other folks‚Äôs videos and have learned a thing or two to boot. I‚Äôm convinced that our governments fear of this app is based in the free flowing nature of the interactions and information exchange than it does with any Chinese espionage. They don‚Äôt want us to learn, grow, and organize. They want us to be scared ignorant consumers completely dependent on their sources for our information. This platform also exposes their lies and manipulation and has the potential to remove our blindfolds. I think this app may go down in history as the catalyst for the profound shift in human consciousness that is taking place right now. 10/10

review: tiktok has been incorrectly flagging and deleting marginalized creator's videos, especially ones concerning their own marginalization. they will even completely ban marginalized users for violating community guidelines that were never violated in these videos in the first place, and then refuse to restore their account. tiktok's team does all of this for absolutely no reason i can discern besides promoting a particularly disturbing agenda or for monetary gain. this is blatant censorship. it's to the point where if marginalized users even speak out on the incorrect flagging of their videos, they most certainly will be banned. it's absurdly common on tiktok for marginalized creators to have multiple accounts because even just by making content on this app, you're likely to get at least 1 account banned. of course, if you aren't lgbt, bipoc, or disabled, your videos are a lot more likely to find success on tiktok. if you are, even if you create the most wholesome kid-friendly content, you're A LOT more likely to end up shadowbanned. this disgusting behavior needs to stop. we need to normalize holding these social media empires accountable for their reprehensible biases.

I noticed a while ago the comment section is broken for me. Usually the most popular comments are displayed at the top but not always so I just continued as normal, but I noticed the pinned comments weren‚Äôt pinned and were no where near the top.

A time limit I couldn‚Äôt make bc I for one; had no idea they messaged me, two; I didn‚Äôt think they‚Äôd have a time limit after being useless for weeks prior (and just in general I now know) and three; bc I have things to do outside of the app so even if I knew I couldn‚Äôt make it.

I randomly came back again like a month later and all of my chat history with any support contact was gone. Both of theses instances happened after messaging over and over without a reply.
title: Comment section | support team

review: The overall concept is great but the experience of actively engaging is more annoying than it needs to be.  TERRIBLE moderation; everyone I follow has had at least one or two videos taken down or have been actively suppressed, or even get live streams cut off for very minor offenses if any at all, whereas some more harmful content I‚Äôve seen stitched at least three times and probably reported a hundred more before ever taken down.  Video editing interface is not the smoothest either and could probably use features like an ‚Äúundo‚Äù button or toggle buttons to make adjusting durations of effects easier especially on longer videos.  And the app is slow to give all of its users new features it rolls out, leaving most users to discover them on accident, whereas most apps/programs would probably include new features in an update that everyone can engage.  I hope Tik Tok sees this because they have much to address before frustrated creators begin to actually leave the app for other platforms.

title: PLEASE

review: Decent app for a time waster, however while scrolling you can and will come across "lives". A lot of these lives are unrelated to content I interact with in any way. One of these such lives had a content warning, however the poster was simply interacting with her audience, while I didn't stick around long compared to other things it was. Tame. Then later I came upon a mass of lives, with no content warning, containing "ASMR" or very loud noises on an endless loop, which can be VERY upsetting for a lot of people who are reactive to auditory stimulation (such as myself). Then there is lives of people pretending to have sex or even masturbating, which NONE of which is relative to content I have interacted with, nor do they have content warnings. Under content preferences the only "filter" is language based rather than helping to filter out content which may be upsetting some how. Marking things as "not interested" or not interacting at all will still result in feeds of the same exact content. Many things explicitly against guidelines on the app are also ignored while fully clothed, non explicit, non offensive content gets taken down and stricken.

review:
I use TikTok to post about current events & news. TikTok has wrongly given me violations for violence, most recently when I posted Will Smith slapping Chris Rock. I even posted it as a skit because I thought it was fake initially. After having my video removed, to test the process, I reported the exact same Will & Chris video from 5 other accounts. TikTok said those videos were NOT in violation, however it is for my account. They were exactly the same. It appears violations are not equally distributed & small content creators are heavily penalized. The other 2 vids, were the mask disagreement from Carmine‚Äôs in New York ( without sound) and a disagreement with table flipping from Golden Corral, both videos used from news sources and both still on TikTok today on other accounts. I don‚Äôt know who the arbitrator of my account is that makes these decisions, but there is clear bias. 
I also receive pops ups, at least weakly, when watching videos from Black creators asking if the video is appropriate. I never get these pop ups in other creators. 
It‚Äôs hard not to feel the bias when your video is removed & then there are 5 videos to follow with the same content.
title: TikTok False Community Guidelines Hits

review:
Hello,

Overall I love tiktok and I don‚Äôt have many complaints about the app itself except for one that bugs me a lot. On tiktok, you used to be able to search for video by using keywords and you could even find video that you watched in the last 7 days if you didn‚Äôt like the video and the app refreshed. Now you can only search for users, sounds, and hashtags. Most people on tiktok either don‚Äôt use hashtags or the tags they used don‚Äôt even relate to the video (e.i. using popular hashtags to get more exposure when the video doesn‚Äôt relate to the tag). Plus one hashtag could have hundreds of thousands of videos. I feel like it‚Äôs made it so much hard to find videos about a specific topic or trend. If an event happens, I can only see the videos that come up on my fyp (which is usually a small amount mixed in with other content) or hope there‚Äôs a accurate hashtag that everyone is using (which isn‚Äôt likely). I really hope Tiktok brings back the original feature.

No one in the TikTok‚Äôs are minors, and after reading through the guidelines to see any possible way I could‚Äôve violated them, I just couldn‚Äôt understand how because I wasn‚Äôt given an explanation as to why. It was just ‚Äúminor safety.‚Äù I requested for an appeal and it was rejected and completely taken down. 

Now what I don‚Äôt understand is how tiktok is okay with letting half naked teens on this app (most of them are still minors) and allowing sexually suggestive TikTok‚Äôs to blow up without being taken down but my innocent TikTok‚Äôs are flagged for ‚Äúminor safety‚Äù reasons although they never actually violated any of the guidelines. I don‚Äôt know who reviews the appeals, or who flags the TikTok‚Äôs, if it‚Äôs just automatic then at least fix it so that actual people are reviewing the appeal requests. I really don‚Äôt understand. It‚Äôs very discouraging to the minority of people who are just trying to start out on tiktok.

Things like location, and even working in the background to take your search history too. I thought it was too outrageous to be true. I looked it up and what do you know, even the Military has forbid shoulders or anyone apart of it to have the app on there phone, how a company planned to sue TikTok for selling literal children‚Äôs information to China. I deleted the app immediately, my information already is out there but no way am I letting it take anymore. If the news is fake news than I need to get a response debunking everything, and giving me clear evidence that goes against all other evidence out there until nothing can even suggest to this being true. I urge others to do the same. I‚Äôm keeping a two star rating because I‚Äôm not 100% sure if it‚Äôs all true, but if it is I‚Äôm not taking that 10% chance just to laugh when I can use other platforms that DO NOT do that.

review: I love TikTok even though I acknowledge that it is perhaps the ultimate echo chamber: the algorithm knows what you need to hear more than you do because it is measuring where you spend your time and energy NOT what you self-report you want to hear. It feels like it is literally using some form of metadata to hold a mirror up to you and (at least on my side of queer, mental health, crafty TikTok) that mirror often reflects myself in a way that I realize is more beautiful than I ever saw myself insolation. In a big way, I love TikTok (perhaps even too much) because it is so kind and gentle to my inner child in a way that life lever was for me growing up as an actual child. TikTok allows me to see myself through the compassionate way I see other people and I feel seen, validated, and even loved in ways I never experienced organically from my daily life as a growing person. Thank you, TikTok for helping me address my low self-esteem and body dysmorphia.
title: A Chaotic Port in A Wounded World

title: TikTok‚Äôs Community Guidelines and Banning System

review:
First of all, TikTok is incredibly easy to use. The user interface is simple and intuitive, making it easy for anyone to create and share their content. The app also has a wide range of editing tools and effects that users can use to enhance their videos and make them stand out.

One of the best things about TikTok is the community that it has built. The app has a vast user base from all over the world, and it is a great platform for people to connect and collaborate. Users can follow each other, like videos, and leave comments, creating a positive, engaging environment that encourages creativity and self-expression.

Another feature that sets TikTok apart from other social media platforms is its algorithm. The app uses a powerful algorithm that analyzes user data to recommend videos that they are likely to enjoy. This means that users can discover new content and creators that they might not have found otherwise, making the app a great source of inspiration and entertainment.

Overall, TikTok is an excellent app for anyone who wants to create and share short-form videos. With a plethora of editing tools, effects, and filters, the app allows users to unleash their creativity and produce videos that are fun, engaging and shareable. The app's supportive community and powerful algorithm make it an incredibly enjoyable platform to use, and it is easy to see why it has become so popular worldwide.
title: Tremendous App (TikTok)

title: I love this app

review: My name is Yoshikage Kira. I'm 33 years old. My house is in the northeast section of Morioh, where all the villas are, and I am not married. I work as an employee for the Kame Yu department stores, and I get home every day by 8 PM at the latest. I don't smoke, but I occasionally drink. I'm in bed by 11 PM, and make sure I get eight hours of sleep, no matter what. After having a glass of warm milk and doing about twenty minutes of stretches before going to bed, I usually have no problems sleeping until morning. Just like a baby, I wake up without any fatigue or stress in the morning. I was told there were no issues at my last check-up. I'm trying to explain that I'm a person who wishes to live a very quiet life. I take care not to trouble myself with any enemies, like winning and losing, that would cause me to lose sleep at night. That is how I deal with society, and I know that is what brings me happiness. Although, if I were to fight I wouldn't lose to anyone.
title: My name is Yoshikage Kira.

review: I bow to all content creators for sharing themselves with the world. Energetic and brave producers put their knowledge, talent, creativity, emotions and vulnerability into their content. Educational, entertaining and I can‚Äôt believe you said that. Retired and living alone, hearing what people have to say on TikTok, gives a sense of connection to what‚Äôs going on with real people that otherwise I would have no contact with. On the down side there are liars, pretenders and advertisers that want your attention. And trolls who are compelled to take their bad feelings out on everyone with criticizing comments, while hiding behind anonymity like the cowards they are. I learned more about myself from medical professional and people with the same maladies sharing their personal experiences on TikTok, than I did over 70 years of living and seeking help for what ails me. In a sentence, TikTok has made my life better. However, would I prefer in person contact with people. Of course
title: Benefits & Not so much

review: To be honest I don‚Äôt believe it‚Äôs very fairy of TikTok to be making an update that makes people who post videos that weren‚Äôt recorded have less views now, just because the videos are ‚Äúlow quality content‚Äù. review:
My son began a company about a year ago, a clothing brand called ‚Äúunxpectd‚Äù. Two months ago, he and 7 friends, moved from Lexington, KY to Los Angeles, CA, in pursuit of a dream. Their success exponentially grew when they started their TikTok account ‚Äúunxpectd house‚Äù.

He works 18 hour days and with the time difference, I only get to talk to him a couple times a week. I am so thankful for TikTok. Every day, when I finish surgical cases, I tune in to ‚Äúunxpectd house‚Äù to watch these guys live, laugh and create.  They want to motivate the youth of today to never give up, to pursue their dreams.... no matter where you are from or with what little you start.

Thank you for providing a remarkable, ‚Äúunxpectd‚Äùway to provide my daily reassurance that my son is safe, happy, and healthy!!! Keep up the great work with your site!! TikTok is influencing so many lives.  My story, as a Mom whose 19 year old son now lives 2,200 miles away, is a small testimony of the connections and impact your company provides!!
title: My daily check-in on my son‚Äôs happiness

review: Now where do I start? Well, to start off Tiktok has been life-changer. The older generations like the boomers won‚Äôt ever understand that. After having this app for a couple of months, I have made friends and lifelong connections. This app has made me laugh when I have felt down and has made me feel welcomed. It has brought my generation (Gen Z) together in a positive way, it‚Äôs crazy to say we are all living the same life in a way. We can all relate to mental, family, and school issues and anything in between. I honestly think that the older generations are just jealous of us because WE ALL can come together, WE ALL stick up for each other no matter our race, ethnic background and or sexual orientation. WE uplift each other. Tiktok has also taught me so much REAL history that these white-washed American History books never did. I NEVER GET TIRED OF THIS APP!! Unlike other social media: Instagram, Snapchat, Twitter, Facebook etc. Tiktok never fails.

review: I like this app. I use it almost every day, and I like what you can do on it. But, I have a few things that I want to bring up. For one, you are ‚Äúshadowbanning‚Äù certain accounts. Most of those accounts are LGBT+ and/or POC. Care to explain that? You post about how Black Lives Matter, but you give white creators more attention. You also don‚Äôt give small accounts much attention at all. What‚Äôs up with that? Also, videos often get taken down for ‚Äúviolating community guidelines‚Äù even when those videos in fact do not violate any guidelines. Yet you don‚Äôt bother taking down videos that actually do violate your guidelines. Also also, sometimes I will be watching a video, and it will have very few, if any, comments/likes. Yet when I go to that creator‚Äôs page and select that same video, there are suddenly many more comments and likes. Again, why is that? Going back to my point about videos being taken down without good reason, most if the videos being taken down are LGBTQ+ and/or POC. These videos often speak out of issues happening in our society. Get it together, TikTok.
title: I like it, but it needs improvement.

review: This app truly is becoming the next vine, so naturally I was thrilled to download this after seeing Pewdipie‚Äôs meme review on this app! However, the algorithm on the for you page is extremely bias towards the little guy, which is GREAT... until you hit 900 fans and they no longer feature your material on the for you page unless you‚Äôre either a verified ‚Äúpopular creator‚Äù or have old memes that have TONS of likes, PLEASE change this! As a creator with 900+ fans who probably don‚Äôt see me on their feed all the time because of all their other subscriptions, so it is hard to maintain a popular status with original content. Also, the videos should be reviewed before immediately being taken down, it really hurts the opinion of both the fans and the creators who are trying to enjoy original meme content and I fear that TIKTOK may lose creators and fans if this issue persists. However, I believe if TikTok stops marketing cringy apps while marketing some of their original creators memes and changes the other two problems previously mentioned, their western fan base will continue to grow!

title: Leave TikTok alone

review: This app has been an invaluable source of knowledge and inspiration for me. It has provided me with a wide array of informative videos that have taught me essential skills I was never formally taught, such as cleaning techniques, cooking recipes, and organizational strategies. Not only that, but I have also been able to stay up-to-date with current world news and events, allowing me to broaden my understanding of global affairs. Furthermore, I have had the privilege of virtually exploring breathtaking destinations across the globe, filling me with awe and wanderlust. Additionally, this app has been an excellent companion in parenting, providing me with valuable advice on raising children, suggesting the best recipes tailored to their needs, and offering an extensive selection of useful toys and engaging activities. Without a doubt, I have never encountered such a remarkable and indispensable app that consistently offers such profound usefulness and assistance in various aspects of my life.
title: So inspirational and educational.

review: My name is Yoshikage Kira. I'm 33 years old. My house is in the northeast section of Morioh, where all the villas are, and I am not married. I work as an employee for the Kame Yu department stores, and I get home every day by 8 PM at the latest. I don't smoke, but I occasionally drink. I'm in bed by 11 PM, and make sure I get eight hours of sleep, no matter what. After having a glass of warm milk and doing about twenty minutes of stretches before going to bed, I usually have no problems sleeping until morning. Just like a baby, I wake up without any fatigue or stress in the morning. I was told there were no issues at my last check-up. I'm trying to explain that I'm a person who wishes to live a very quiet life. I take care not to trouble myself with any enemies, like winning and losing, that would cause me to lose sleep at night. That is how I deal with society, and I know that is what brings me happiness. Although, if I were to fight I wouldn't lose to anyone.

And if you don‚Äôt want people either watching your videos, or if your just afraid of getting rude comments from haters, (which doesn‚Äôt happen often at ALL) you can either create a private account which keeps people from watching your videos unless they send you a request and you can deny or accept. Tik tok is an app where I can be myself and have fun. I think it is cool how everyone makes their own videos and puts their own twist to it. The app does have some bugs. For example on the‚Äúfor you page‚Äù by giving people time to look at the video. I also recommend that they keep the app running in the background to watch the same video I was on when you leave the app. You can be creative in your own way in just a couple of seconds. title: it‚Äôs a great app but..

review:
I first downloaded TIK TOK last September in 2018 and everything was fine. I made videos, got followers, got likes, the usual. Up til February, I had about 150 followers, 160 videos, and 300 likes! Then there was a new update on the app, so I updated it. Then when I went on the app - it asked me to fill in my password, age, email, etc. to verify myself (bc of the security update) so I did.
But then when I went to my profile page.... IT WAS BLANK, COMPLETELY BLANK!!!!!!! 
MY VIDEOS WERE GONE!!!!! SO WERE MY FOLLOWERS AND LIKES!!!! I reported the problem, and they did nothing! So I asked a few of my friends about and they said that nothing like this has ever happened to them before, but I heard it has happened to many other people before!! My friends said that I was probably hacked, I was shocked ( considering that I had a private account) 
So I deleted the app and warned a few of my younger friends not to download it.
It might happen to you, so be careful when you download this app.
title: Don't download it!!! READ THIS WHOLE THING!!!!

title: They permanently banned my account for no reason!?!

review: There was a time , I literally went to bed watching TikTok and if I fell sleep , awoke to TikTok. It became my world for sure. I was layed up with severe depression, my 26 & 1/2 yr marriage ended at the height of the pandemic shutdown , we had jus moved into our newly built house. He left me the week of Valentines like a thief in the night. TikTok & bourbon became my life. Through the recovery community I realized I needed help. I went to work, worked a year got injured on the job. I've been out of work 3 yrs, no source of income, I learned a few things through tik too, and I fight everyday to maintain my sobriety from alcohol and prescription pill addiction. TikTok has been the solid source in my life and keeping me straight. I've made friends, I treasure dearly. I love to pop in on random lives and run their likes up , I share their video lives to keep them on the fyp. I feel it's the least I can do since the ppl on this app unknowingly saved my life.
title: TikTok clearly saves LIVES

review: Tiktok is a great app. I will admit to that. It‚Äôs fun to make content and enjoy other peoples content as well, BUT a major problem they have is banning, removal of videos, and consequences for the said things. For example, on my tiktok account Tiktok has removed my videos around 3+ times. After I submit an appeal for the video, Tiktok would often respond with ‚ÄúThank you for submitting your appeal. We have reviewed and restored your content. We apologize for any inconvenience this may have caused. Thank you for being a part of TikTok community‚Äù (and yes I did have to copy this down word for word physically). Now after I receive the said response, Tiktok bans me from posting, commenting, editing my profile, Etc. The consequences are ridiculous especially when after you yourself has been told you‚Äôve done nothing wrong. I have 2 other friends who also has gone through the exact same thing. Many people on TikTok have complained about TikTok‚Äôs consequences and judgement of what fits the community guidelines. TikTok needs to fix this issue!

Instead of taking down multiple videos of MINE because I‚Äôm wearing spandex and a bathing suit top when I see so many people shaking their butts and showing provocative dances? title: To whom it may concern

review: I love tiktok and how it brings people together, but it is unacceptable to me and others who use this app, that the team behind all of this (knowing this is a 12+ app) will allow nudity content (men‚Äôs parts specifically) even after it has been reported by a lot of people. What I speak of is now on a private account but it was once public and the video is still up. Here is the problem, people who spoke about about this were silenced by having their videos removed or having a week ban on their page. Tiktok has also been limiting and banning the content of black creators and spiritual creators as well, but not those who discriminate against others blatantly on their pages. Where is the balance? Keep all the nasty stuff, but block out those who are doing no harm? Take this review down to change your rating; that‚Äôs okay, I have copy pasted this and have videos saved from the app talking about and showing the obvious things you let slide! You have a lot of potential TikTok, buck up or someone is going to make a new platform out of spite and convince others to move on! title: Content regulation issues

review: I downloaded TikTok with the idea that it would be a good environment and fun. I wanted to have something that me and my kids could love. I removed the app from my phone, so my kids won‚Äôt feel bad about how they look and won‚Äôt learn hate. There are people on this app spreading misinformation about things like the pandemic, the election, etc. There is also a lot of hate speech on this app. Depending on your looks, content against the guidelines will be ignored no matter how much you report the post. When it comes to hate speech some is ignored while other are instantly punished. These actions from the people behind this app, give people the idea that hate speech is okay to do to one group of people, but not another. On this app many creators are being denied their accounts back or views for doing something that isn‚Äôt against the guidelines, while others who do the same thing and are completely ignored all on the basis of looks. If you want your kids to learn how to be shallow and insecure, this is the app for you.

title: Best app

review: My name is Yoshikage Kira. I'm 33 years old. My house is in the northeast section of Morioh, where all the villas are, and I am not married. I work as an employee for the Kame Yu department stores, and I get home every day by 8 PM at the latest. I don't smoke, but I occasionally drink. I'm in bed by 11 PM, and make sure I get eight hours of sleep, no matter what. After having a glass of warm milk and doing about twenty minutes of stretches before going to bed, I usually have no problems sleeping until morning. Just like a baby, I wake up without any fatigue or stress in the morning. I was told there were no issues at my last check-up. I'm trying to explain that I'm a person who wishes to live a very quiet life. I take care not to trouble myself with any enemies, like winning and losing, that would cause me to lose sleep at night. That is how I deal with society, and I know that is what brings me happiness. Although, if I were to fight I wouldn't lose to anyone.

title: yes.

review:
I absolutely love TikTok but the problem I have, is with the disabling of direct messaging for people under 16, which just got enforced. Since there are already settings on who can direct message the user, and users can block each other, hate speech and inappropriate activity shouldn‚Äôt be much of an issue. I think that it is also a good idea to advocate online safety on the app so things like direct messaging can be promoted and used more appropriately. That being said, I completely understand why the restriction exists, but if you guys want to keep it I suggest maybe reducing the limit to 14 yrs instead of 16 yrs, because users that are at least 14 should be able to be responsible with direct messages. If this is an app for teenagers, all teenagers should be able to use the direct messaging. Family pairing and things of that nature should be a choice. Restrictions should not be automatic. Thank you for listening and I wish well for this app and this company. 

- Julianna

review: So I admit, I love the app. Im an artist and I love to be able to show my art off for others too see. But there‚Äôs one problem, the shadowban problem. I had over 9600 likes and over 1k followers. They ranked it down. The views on my videos went down. I find it really weird that this happened because I understand that people can unfollow and unlike and such, but why the views go down? Another part that angers me is that I post nothing that isn‚Äôt appropriate. I don‚Äôt post NSFW and even if I did, I‚Äôd put a warning (fake gore, fake blood, nsfw, 13+, etc.) so I find it very odd that this happened. I‚Äôd like that to be fixed. title: Love it!

review: Ok so everyone knows this app, so I kinda went and did a little research. This app is the next birthground for negativity and creativity. It is more so negatively towards a certain fandom that has been constantly bullied throughout almost the WHOLE app‚Äôs history. Yes we all know it, I‚Äôm talking about furries. I‚Äôm not a furry but this app portrays them as the enemy since most of them are gamers, and this makes people think about doing verbally or even PHYSICALLY bad things to them and it negatively affects their mental mind. This even happens to kids and can lead to a unhealthy mindset and can ruin their future career if they want to draw art that they love. This is really not good for a developing brain, and I want to let all of you furries and gamers that furries are people too. If you don‚Äôt like furries or anything about them, then don‚Äôt say anything negative about them online! You need to think about possible consequences and reconsider it. But back to the topic, Yes it is a place for creative people to inspire younger ones,but keep in mind it can also do some damage to someone‚Äôs brain mentally if they are being bullied online. I have wanted to let you all know that think before you act and don‚Äôt bully. Good day and be safe online.
title: Negativity

review:
I would give it five stars but TikTok is so prejudice, if creators who‚Äôve actually done nothing wrong are getting banned or deleted without proper investigation (meaning all of their videos were watched, comments were read, and source content were properly evaluated) they should be left as they are. I‚Äôve seen so many creators mimic others who are doing something on the edge of PG-13 and R who have less views, aren't the ‚Äústereotypical‚Äù attractive by shallow people, or even those with fewer videos being removed because someone felt the need to be a snowflake or be jealous of someone else. Listen to your content creators and do your investigations the proper way or start looking harder into the creators who constantly stand at that rated R edge and the trolls and then I‚Äôll consider giving five stars.

When trying to report a fake profile and the only options being ‚ÄúMe‚Äù or ‚ÄúCelebrity‚Äù but the ‚ÄúCelebrity‚Äù doesn‚Äôt allow you to find the actual profile of the person being infringed upon is a disappointment. You guys need to fix this.

review: I avoided tiktok for a long time but there‚Äôs so many amazing resources on there. I‚Äôve gotten advice and content for the foreign languages in studying in university as well as study tips. I‚Äôve gotten to learn about books, movies, music, and art through this silly little app. I‚Äôm also keeping in contact with my cousins who moved across country and I get to tell them all my silly little stories they never got a chance to hear in person and they love it. I probably have like 7 followers but it doesn‚Äôt even matter. I‚Äôm connecting with the world in ways I never could on Facebook/Instagram. It‚Äôll be a sad and concerning day if they choose to imitate North Korea/Iran/Russia and ban the app because they‚Äôre too foolish to learn how algorithms even work. ‚ÄúTracking pupil dilation‚Äù give me a break Brenda. We‚Äôre telling ghost stories and laughing at videos of dogs.
title: Genuinely happy I have this

review: While some companies like the FBI-ran, CIA-supported Congressionally-approved Facebook program limits content based on their monetary income from it, TikTok allows American citizens the freedom to share content in a much more fun, effective way. You can actually film, edit, and put your content to the music you choose for free. Because of TikTok I found a supported voice as a Chef that I never experienced with Instagram (which is mostly models) and Facebook (which is mostly a photo album). Here I found an opportunity to open up and show the world my gifts, and share my recipes with wonderful music (that would be deleted on Facebook.) Here I find freedom, and happiness‚Äîyou‚Ä¶listening Congress? This is an influential voter talking. We all know how much stock you‚Äôve purchased in Facebook and where your allegiance lies. This is a happy place, and it doesn‚Äôt need to reformat as ‚Äúmeta‚Äù to pose as more interesting than it already is.

review:
Tiktok is an amazing app, you can find a variety of great content on there, however there are many problems. First thing, the moderation system is not good. There are videos where someone is simply eating food and it gets taken down for ‚Äúhate speech‚Äù or ‚Äúsexual content‚Äù it‚Äôs ridiculous. Not only that but there are times where actual content that does include that sort of stuff can stay up for about a week with no moderation. Second, this whole flash warning thing, tiktok should not be the ONLY ones in control of a video that has a fast flash effect or whatever. Users who post the video should also have access to enabling things like sensitive content, flash warnings or make their own custom warnings for a certain audience, this is because A LOT of things are looked over by tiktok so they could use the extra help. 

These are really the only problems have with the app. It works fine but the moderation system needs major work and should be focused on more than just the layout of the app.

review:
Today, my daughter was banned from a parent-run account, and was unable to appeal before being logged out. There are more important things that Tiktok could be focusing on than deleting the account of teenagers, but that‚Äôs only some of the problem. 

Now, with the new account that I made her, she‚Äôs unable to follow all her friends; it shows that she‚Äôs following them for a moment, but then when she returns to her page, suddenly she‚Äôs never interacted with their account before. There are bigger problems with this app that could be targeted, like the inability to interact with other users, or the inappropriate content on this ‚Äúfamily‚Äù app, than a teenager attempting to access content targeted towards her. Normally, I wouldn‚Äôt be mad about her being removed from a social media platform, but this was something we set up together, and it holds (held, now) quite a bit of sentimental value. 

This app keeps adding new, unnecessary features, then when people get comfortable with them, they take the feature away, The ability to pin comments has been removed, which I think is absolutely bogus. Please, fix your app.

I‚Äôm in bed by 11 PM, and make sure I get eight hours of sleep, no matter what. After having a glass of warm milk and doing about twenty minutes of stretches before going to bed, I usually have no problems sleeping until morning. review:
My name is Yoshikage Kira. I‚Äôm 33 years old. My house is in the northeast section of Morioh, where all the villas are, and I am not married. I work as an employee for the Kame Yu department stores, and I get home every day by 8 PM at the latest. I don‚Äôt smoke, but I occasionally drink. I‚Äôm in bed by 11 PM, and make sure I get eight hours of sleep, no matter what. After having a glass of warm milk and doing about twenty minutes of stretches before going to bed, I usually have no problems sleeping until morning. Just like a baby, I wake up without any fatigue or stress in the morning.

I was told there were no issues at my last check-up. I‚Äôm trying to explain that I‚Äôm a person who wishes to live a very quiet life. I take care not to trouble myself with any enemies, like winning and losing, that would cause me to lose sleep at night. That is how I deal with society, and I know that is what brings me happiness. Although, if I were to fight I wouldn‚Äôt lose to anyone.

title: Tick Tock needs to make some changes.

review:
1.  I think bringing back the "near me" tab would be great for smaller creators to get more exposure due to the fact it doesn't matter if they're popular or not, it's based on location.
2. I (& I'm sure many other creators) favorite videos that give them ideas. It would be super helpful if we had playlists that allowed us to organize our favorites into categories. 
3. I know the FYP is based on an algorithm that shows us videos that YOU think we will enjoy, but another way to show us videos we'll enjoy as well as finding creators we have things in common with is being able to follow hashtags. 
4. Small creators should be able to go live, just because a creator isn't "famous" doesn't mean they shouldn't be able to connect with their followers. 
5. Expand the limitation of characters when commenting. We can't always message a creator questions or advice, especially if they're famous. The number of times I've had to reply to myself just to finish what I'm saying & it then get lost in a pool of replies of other people is rather frustrating. 
6. Add a dislike button. This will allow viewers to simply say they don't like the video without it coming across as bullying or being rude, or subjecting the viewer to other's opinions when they comment. It was also give the creator a better look at how well a video is doing because it's hard to see every comment made & properly judge the video.

title: New Account

review:
By far the worst social media app as far as manipulation and negative impact on your well being from using it. If you don‚Äôt mind your kid getting told how everyday that they are broken, diseased, or be groomed into porn for the day they turn 18. This is the app for you. 

On a technical side, the app has all it‚Äôs error messages set up to blame the user or the network. They don‚Äôt even remotely pay the creators the value they bring in. They have a Heating effect that means ‚Äúgoing viral‚Äù is them promoting a vid. They will continue to ask for all your contacts no matter how long you use the app. They will continue to push pop-ups and paying to promote your video etc. nonstop and make those ads seem like notifications from living humans interacting with you. 

It really is all the worst parts of the intrernet baked into one very well-tuned Attentional Algorithm. Pop-ups, pushing teens towards porn, fake popularity, anonymity used to be more cruel, stealing from your data and your time. Oh, and all the depression and suicide encouragement on the app. I reported someone telling a kid to take their own life but every time the app tells you that is allowed.

review:
For starters, the new activity feed is horrendous. Tiktok is not a DM-heavy platform, there is no reason a feature that almost nobody uses should take up so much real estate in the inbox and force video interactions into two separate tabs. It looks bad and has made the otherwise simple task of viewing notifications take 3x longer and several more clicks. 

More recently, I can‚Äôt add voiceovers to my videos anymore. The option does not appear on the right side menu while editing. Even if I click the drop down arrow for more options, it only goes down as far as voice effects, for which the icon is literally cut in half. Your editing tools don‚Äôt even fit on your UI. 

Please fix this or prioritize voiceovers higher in the side menu as many of us use voiceovers in every video and don‚Äôt ever use other editing features like the filters or voice effects, but until this issue is fixed we can‚Äôt even see the voiceover option since it‚Äôs choked out of the menu by features we never use and can‚Äôt disable.

title: TikTok is amazing

review: When it comes to dancing, singing, and comedic videos, we all know Tiktok is chock full of it. But my problem with this app lies in the fact that whenever a serious event is happening in the world and people are making informative videos about them in real time, Tiktok picks a side on whichever topic is being talked about and takes down or suppresses videos. I first noticed this when it came to BLM, but I thought it was just the algo being weird, but then it started to suppress videos on AAPI. My final straw was when recently, I‚Äôve been seeing a number of videos concerning what‚Äôs going on in Sheikh Jarrah with the Palestinians. Any and every video I‚Äôve seen about Palestine I‚Äôve seen on this app came from either people I follow on the following tab or I have to search them up myself. Not once have I seen any on my FYP. But I have seen a number of IDF supporters. Same with Trump supporters, or just generally racist content. This is the most irresponsible thing I can think of a huge app like Tiktok doing, because there is so much traffic through this app daily. This is just incredibly disappointing, either show everyone‚Äôs videos or show no ones.
title: Chooses Sides In Important Situations

The app tiktok was created for people to make entertaining content for others to enjoy from my understanding. Which is wrong, the app if full of harassment and discrimination. Creators on the app who are people of color constantly have their content removed solely for the fact that they are not white. However people who are white, if they post videos involving racism. All of the discrimination is kept and doesn‚Äôt break community guidelines. Creators of color break community guidelines for posting about their daily lives, though other people can freely share whatever they please. If you ever comment on someone‚Äôs video you will always be bombarded by people threatening you. Even the creators on tiktok will get death threats and other horrible things. I myself have been harassed on the app and I only ever posted a single video of my dog sleeping. 
In my own opinion based on the things I have seen on the app, the abuse and hate on tiktok is far worse than what you see on instagram. Tiktok will not ban those who threaten others, they do absolutely nothing about it. Instead they ban those who speak up about the abuse. 
Silencing those who are threatened and abused will only make the fire burn hotter.

I have two complaints. One is the notifications. I get sooooo many notifications and it would be easier to manage if under the notifications tab, there were 4 other tabs that separate which notifications I wanna see. However, even when you appeal and are not in violation of their community standards, tiktok will automatically send you a response back for your appeal basically saying it is in violation. Does any real person even look at appeals?  Cause they are not doing their job if a person is. 

 Other than that, this app is a perfect app for making short videos. Please TikTok, fix these two issues.

title: TikTok, I love you

review: When you get the app it‚Äôs all the horror stories you‚Äôve ever heard about it, vapid influencers, teens dancing and crazy people being crazy. After a while the algorithm figures you out and sends you so much useful and interesting and entertaining stuff, enough to get you hooked. But after a while, after expressing more of your interests on the app, the algorithm seems to get confused and doesn‚Äôt know what to do with you. Throwing just about everything at you to see if something sticks, and it doesn‚Äôt, and you say ‚Äúnot interested‚Äù but it doesn‚Äôt seem to do anything. So at the point I‚Äôm at, I‚Äôm conditioned on the app to expect more interesting content, but every day it seems to get worse and worse, and it feels like an app I utilized so well is now just a useless void of advertisements, ‚Äúlives‚Äù and vapid drivel. So in conclusion the app is great for about, let‚Äôs say a year to be generous, then it just turns into a frustrating mess. Oh, and side note, what it really wants is to make you mad, so you rage in the comments, so it inflates the analytics of the video to potentially make it viral, which is all tiktok really wants at the end of the day.

title: TikTok Review

review:
I love tiktok as a platform. I think it‚Äôs got one of the best UI‚Äôs around and has really helped me to extend outside my network as a viewer. As a creator on the other hand - if you‚Äôre interested in getting compensated for your work on tiktok, do NOT sign up for the creator fund. My content reach has drastically declined ever since I signed up and I almost feel like the shadow ban people who are relatively early on in their creator journey so that they do not have to pay people out. I‚Äôve tried using the analytics and posting the same content that went viral prior to joining the creator fund but I have been getting so few views and such little exposure that I have no choice but to assume my videos aren‚Äôt getting the reach they deserve because tiktok wants to save a few bucks. 

Tiktok, you should change this - creators deserve to get the same exposure (or an equal chance) regardless of being a part of the creator fund or not.
title: Creator fund killed my visibility

review:
I was addicted to Tik Tok for a few months, anytime I was bored it was the first app I would go on for hours. But what I noticed is that I believed everything I saw that was put on there, I saw the horrible comments that were put out towards others, and I noticed my younger siblings and friends personality‚Äôs revolving around tik tok. I also feel like the app is made so that you keep scrolling and watch their ads AND (most importantly) to disagree or agree with others online. 
Don‚Äôt get me wrong, it‚Äôs very educational and fun to be on. However, it isn‚Äôt worth it to waste my time seeing other people get harassed or watching random people dance or learning about all these conspiracies in the world or hearing about cryptocurrencies and what not. 
I‚Äôd rather spend my time with others and focus more on my hobbies instead of being on my phone all the time. 
I only have Snapchat now which is great for communicating with friends because taking in too much social media is not healthy! 
Hope this helps anyone who might possibly agree with me or feels the desire to make a change.

title: Horrible app-read review before downloading

review:
My opinions solely as a viewer/consumer, not a creator!!!! TikTok has good content, easy ways to share content with friends, and the FYP algorithm is sometimes scarily accurate to link you to people with the same niche interests. I think TikTok really needs to improve its reporting functions bc there is definitely some sketch and hate speech content being allowed to exist on the app. Otherwise, it's a lot of fun even as someone who doesn't participate in trends or make videos.  

One of my biggest pet peeves is the missing function to copy or follow links from within the TikTok app. For example, if an artist I follow has a link to their store from their profile, I can open the link within TikTok BUT there is no way for me to directly open the link in Chrome/Safari or even to copy the URL to save and open elsewhere. This is very frustrating bc it has led to a lot of dead-end searches and is a lot of extra work to type out and search specific link URL's outside the app. Reallt hope TikTok can update this feature soon.

review: Tiktok is an open space where people can share ideas, creations and laughter with each other on a mass scale very quickly. Tiktok however has blatant bias and it actively suppresses POC (people of color) creators. There is explicitly racist content that is left up while people who speak out against or try to bring attention to it, even jokingly, can end up shadowbanned, have their posts deleted, banned from lives PERMANENTLY and in some cases even have their accounts taken down. Tiktok is supposed to be be a safe and open space and has in many ways failed to meet its own guidelines for ALL the people who use it. Hopefully the minds behind this app that has the ability to be a tool and a vehicle that radically changes the face of social media and takes lead of it, take heed of the creators who feel their voice actively being suppressed and choose to do something about it because people are making a career and livelihood of this. Thank you

review: TikTok is an amazing app. It's the app I use the most, and always keeps me entertained. There isn't much I'd change about it. Though, I have one small suggestion. For earlier IPhone users (IPhone 5-7/8), our phones are rather slow. For example, I have a small account where I post often. Sometimes when I try and post a video, TikTok crashes in the middle of the process. It annoys me because I can never get the video out. My suggestion is; when you go to your home screen, and it asks whether you want to finish editing or quit...I believe it should have the option of saving the unfinished video to drafts. It would make it much easier, not only for me,  but others with this problem. If this is possible to do, please make this feature in the app. Although I would'nt change anything in your already great app, this would be the only thing. Thank you for reading over my review.

title: the app is fun but there are so many problems.

review: countless creators who are LGBTQIA+, POC, Muslim (or openly practice religions other than Christianity), and/or of other minority groups have their videos taken down or shadow banned by the app. In some cases entire accounts are deleted. Not to mention that videos speaking out on these issues are almost always deleted by the app within days of uploading. Reasons for bans are usually claims that videos or creators have "broken community guidelines," all the while white, cisgender, heterosexual, christian, and often male creators can be extremely sexually suggestive to their majority preteen audience and have their videos and accounts untouched by the app. Activism on this app is constantly shut down and shadow banned as well. This app is uplifted by the communities that it forces out of the spotlight, yet it remains popular and successful. What may seem like harmless exclusion from a lighthearted app only instills the standards of white, cis, het supremacy in the world and in the U.S.A. The way this app controls the popularity and accessibility of videos is racist, sexist, homophobic, transphobic, ableist, (the list goes on), but all of that is briefly veiled with 15-second dance videos and poorly-executed lip syncing clips.
title: shadow bans minorities

title: Idk about this app

review:
I find it very impractical that you have to connect your phone number to an account in order to send messages. I find it even more ridiculous that you can only have your phone number linked to 1 account. Any other social media will allow you to use the same phone number for multiple accounts. Without knowing this, I linked my phone number to a shared account for my friend and I (which I will most likely not be messaging on). I would have to delete the shared account *and then* wait 30 days for the account to permanently delete in order to link my phone number to my personal account, to be able to message other users. I definitely think there could‚Äôve been a better way to approach this, and that this is an issue that should be looked at and resolved. 

Aside from that, however, I do find myself on this app for hours at a time. The content makes me laugh and I appreciate that. I only wish that I could respond to my friends who have sent me posts on my personal account. Or even share content with them.

title: Tik tok

review:
Hello everyone,

Today I wanted to take a moment and talk about how great TikTok has been for me. I know that some people may be a bit skeptical about using this platform, but I am here to tell you that you won't regret it.

When I first joined TikTok, I was a bit overwhelmed. There were so many different videos and trends that I had to familiarize myself with. But I soon saw the value in utilizing this platform as a means of connecting with other people. 

Once I got the hang of TikTok, I started to establish an audience of followers. I was amazed at how quickly my videos were being seen and shared. It felt so rewarding to have people watching and engaging with my content. I soon realized that the level of engagement and reach that I could get on TikTok was much greater than anything I could accomplish on other social media platforms.

The most impressive thing about TikTok is the way it allows my audience to interact with me. With the comment sections, I can get direct feedback from people who are interested in what I have to say. This allows me to create content that is tailored to their wants and needs.

Overall, TikTok has been an incredible platform for me to explore my creativity and connect with other people. I highly recommend it for anyone looking for a way to share their voice and reach a larger audience.

Thank you for watching, and remember to keep on creating!

My account has been an outlet for me to talk to others that want to support me in the ‚Äúaesthetic‚Äù community. If you don‚Äôt know what that is, it‚Äôs where creators like me post vlogs and clips of their day and give routines to their followers. review: I love using tiktok just as much as the next person. I‚Äôm only rating this low so it catches the attention of developers, the team, etc. But my drafts have been having issues with saving. Whenever I save a new part to one of my drafts (so far, just when I have replaced an old video clip with a new clip) there is no problem. But when I close the app and then open tiktok again: it prompts me to save it as it‚Äôs own separate draft video. If I choose not to save the separate draft (just a single clipped portion from one of the drafts I recently saved) then it deletes that new draft (that I did not make as it‚Äôs own video) but it also deletes the same clip in my original draft (the one that I actually meant to replace a clip in). I am forced to save the clipped portion of a draft and keep it in my drafts so that it doesn‚Äôt delete from my original draft. If I choose to delete the clipped portion of a draft (even days after having updated my original draft) it will still delete both clips of the video in both drafts. This is very bothersome and I‚Äôve had to retake many videos because of this. Thank you!
