review:
I can not believe you guys banned #blacklivesmatter and all it‚Äôs other variations, including #georgefloyd. As a platform as large and widespread as you are, you should be lending a hand to all that‚Äôs been happening in the world. Instead, you prevent these tagged to be spread across millions of accounts, who are trying to inform others and keep people safe. 

Why? To protect the kids of their innocence? To not let the 4 and 5 year olds to see all the chaos in the world, when your app states you have to be 13 years or older to use it? The exact same age- might I add- you have to be to use Instagram; and even there, tags and chains of stories are being spread like wildfire. Mounds of information being spread on how to keep people safe, what to do if you‚Äôll be protesting, details on people who have gone missing and arrested during these times- and you have the AUDACITY to prevent people from using these tags, for what?

title: Story Mode

review: Many people write TikTok off as an app for silly dances, stupid challenges, cringe content. While that content exists in the app (as with many other social sites), for me, TikTok videos have introduced me to many positive things: new and old music I've never heard before, book/film/manga recommendations and critiques, clever comedy, wildly talented artists/musicians, personal finance tips, history lessons, cultural issues, candid glimpses into communities unfamiliar to me, insightful commentary from people in historically marginalized groups, new recipes, tutorials for various things, etc. Everyone's FYP is different, but TikTok can definitely be used as a jumping off point into learning and discovering new things (but do your own research!) In short, TikTok has enhanced my life in many ways. By bringing together creators and users from around the world, I hope TikTok can help us understand each other a little more.

review:
I very much applaud how fast TikTok removes any questionable content.  With that said, the appeals and review process is seriously flawed.  My account is currently under threat of deletion due to ‚ÄúMultiple Community Standards Violations‚Äù  I‚Äôve lost several appeals against those violations despite these violations not being accurate nor even reflecting the content.  I have, on several occasions, contacted the help center to request that the violations be reviewed by an actual person. My requests are always met with the same form letter/message.  I have read and reviewed the TikTok Community Standards and only create content I would allow my own young children to watch. Since I don‚Äôt have millions of followers, my concerns aren‚Äôt taken seriously. I‚Äôm in constant fear of having my fun little corner of the internet removed without warning because a robot somewhere is having a bad day.  

Yes, there are some brilliant content creators who have millions of followers and I don‚Äôt fit into that category.  But TikTok should not forget that this platform was built on the backs of all us little folks who support the larger accounts.  Everyone deserves to be treated respectfully, especially when voicing their concerns.  However, TikTok doesn‚Äôt seem to care about us little folks anymore.

- PostPosterofPosts
Do better TikTok!!  Please have an actual person review my so called violations.

review:
Tiktok is a fine app, and pretty good if you just want to watch videos. But for creators it can be awful. For the amount of people on Tiktok, there needs to be WAY more employees monitoring reports and comment sections. I‚Äôve seen minors get doxxed, people threatening to kill or kidnap kids, and multiple creators I know of have gotten bullied off the app. They take down some videos for no reason, but leave up completely inappropriate ones. It‚Äôs possibly the most harmful social media platform out there. Also, they do nothing to regulate the ‚Äú12+‚Äù rating. There are kids as young as eight and nine on there, exposed to any creeps on the app. Tbh if they made a kids version, or even a women‚Äôs version of the app, it would be so much better. But there‚Äôs way to many men on there who think it‚Äôs a dating site, or even a porn site. It‚Äôs a dangerous and toxic environment for almost all creators, especially women and children.
In addition to this, they illegally and unconsensually use your location data to show your videos to nearby people, or show you videos relevant to your area.

review: I‚Äôve been using this app about a year. There‚Äôs not really anything wrong with the app itself, but instead the other users and the way the marketers run it. I used to love TikTok, but if you ever have a video that goes ‚Äúviral‚Äù beware. The amount of hate I have received is more that anyone should have to deal with. I used to love it, I felt like it was somewhere I could be myself, but that all changed very fast when I gained some momentum. The bigger my account got (I‚Äôm at 27k currently) the more hate I saw on a daily basis, to the point where I avoid reading my comments and sometimes just turn them off, along with duets. I‚Äôd love to interact but TikTok does a very poor job of managing the hate from users, while overly monitoring anyone who isn‚Äôt straight, white, and skinny. So if you don‚Äôt plan on posting, or posting very much, go ahead. But if you do, and aren‚Äôt straight white and skinny, beware. You‚Äôll probably get shadowbanned and you‚Äôll get a lot lot lot of hate.
title: USE WITH CAUTION

review:
I love Tiktok. It's opened my eyes to different cultures and ethnicities and lives that I never would've seen had I not gotten this app. The problem is that there's a massive problem with bigots on this app. 
Rapists, Neo-Nazis, Trump Supporters, White Supremacists, racists, Homophobes, Transphobes, Islamaphobes, Abelists, all of those disgusting people have a platform on this app and make it unsafe for normal people. 
TikTok itself, meaning its moderators and those who make the guideline decisions and staff in general, are bigots too. They regularly shadowban black creators, suppress indigenous accounts so no one can see their stuff, regularly delete tags related to social issues. The BLM and JusticeForGeorge tags were entirely cleared out- a direct attack on free speech. People that talk about these issues get their videos removed, get their accounts flagged and banned during live streams, etc- for doing nothing more than speaking out against hate. 

If you want to get this app, I won't stop you. But you should know that despite the cute dances and fun communities that exist on TikTok, you should know that there is a massive problem censorship and bigotry that comes down from the highest levels.
title: This app is a platform for BIGOTS

review: Okay so this is a really good app. I‚Äôm on it like 24/7. But there are some issues with the app. First, when ever i try to have a conversation with the person going live (I‚Äôm usually the only one keeping them company and just talking a lot), it keeps telling me that I am posting too much content. review: I love this app, however recently my personal account was banned. The reason cited for this was because I was apparently ‚Äúunder thirteen years of age.‚Äù Although I am a minor, I am not thirteen or under and therefore meet the age requirements set by the app. Unfortunately, the only way for me to appeal this ban would be to submit a form of government issued identification, which I do not have because, again, I am a minor. (I‚Äôm not sure about other countries, but in mine, that‚Äôs how it is.) Now, this wouldn‚Äôt be too big of a deal, however I found out that I am not the only person this has happened to. One of my close friends had a similar experience, and was also unable to appeal their account ban despite the fact that neither of us are under the age of thirteen. From reading some of these reviews, it appears we‚Äôre not the only ones to have this issue either. Clearly, whatever system Tiktok is using to determine which users meet the age requirements is deeply flawed, as is the appeal method.

review: TikTok is fun and engaging, more than that however, it‚Äôs a very significant factor in shaping the future social atmosphere as well as changing the present social landscape. For the first time in history, the consumer is the major provider of media content. This means that we have virtually complete control of the available content. I believe that TikTok is doing a good job of encouraging people to make positive content over negative. This is a fundamental difference between them and all other media before it. I am not only hoping that you at TikTok will continue to do this in as many ways as possible, but I am also doing whatever I am able to get other users to see the impact of positive interaction and feedback over negative. Negativity only breeds more negativity. Whereas positivity inspires creativity, happiness, kindness, and overall good will in all who receive it. TikTok, I‚Äôm glad that you exist!

review: Social media can be a prickly weird world. I believe TikTok has created a place that has safe zones and ‚Äúvirtual nooks and crannies‚Äù where almost anyone could find something of interest and find a place to spend a few minutes every day relaxing and rejuvenating. Don‚Äôt get me wrong, I‚Äôve seen plenty of CRAP on here as well, however, you can click right past that as fast as you can and never see it again. I am thrilled with the people who are so openly sharing their passion for their hobbies -wood cutters making a map of the United States out of pieces of wood from the state trees, band members who became national parkRangers and tell us in a whispered voice about the bird calls in the forest! And the un-boxing of a rummage sale dish extravaganza‚Ä¶ So beautiful, so thoughtful so kind hearted. Really there is some thing for everyone recipes, music, dancing it‚Äôs quite entertaining. Thank you TikTok and thank you Tik-Tokers!!!
title: Something for everyone.

review:
i have gone ‚Äúviral‚Äù on tiktok a few times. i have almost 1M views on a video. being ‚Äúfamous‚Äù is not as nice as one might think. my whole life was centered around going viral again and making videos that would get me the most views and likes.
of course tiktok can be a fun platform to create and see others creations, but my personal experience was very toxic. i was always comparing myself to other influencers who are more attractive than me, skinnier than me, got more likes than me, cooler than me, more creative than me, etc. (yes, i know that‚Äôs a me-problem, not a problem with tiktok itself)
tiktok is also extremely addictive. myself and many others find it easy to spend five hours scrolling through the fyp like it‚Äôs nothing. i was wasting my life. in the end, i gained absolutely nothing from tiktok (except a deep hatred for social mediaüòç)!!!
idk, take what you want from this review. i‚Äôm not telling you to not download tiktok. i know that some people really love it. i‚Äôm just trying to warn other individuals who are similar to me, and therefore at risk of having a similar experience.

review: I‚Äôve been using TikTok for over a year for cosplaying and I‚Äôve noticed a lot of problems with the app. A lot of my content started to drop in likes and views and I noticed a lot of other people in the cosplay community having the same problem. Even people in other communities with mass following are having the same problem. We‚Äôve thought it was the algorithm, which it probably is, and it‚Äôs been happening for months now. I would love for more people‚Äôs content to get seen because they are very good! But only big name creators are having their content pushed out, it‚Äôs not fair to smaller creators at all. I‚Äôve emailed TikTok about this but they never got back to me. They also shadowban anyone that speaks out on racism and sexual assault. It wants to keep its platform up but it hides the content that can actually keep it up and spread word. Live stream bans are also a big issue. They typically deny the appeal when you provide your evidence that it shouldn‚Äôt be banned. This app may seem fun but once you‚Äôve been on it for so long, it‚Äôs a disaster. They don‚Äôt even do anything about the actually bullying/hate speech on the app. 10/10 don‚Äôt recommend the platform to anyone

China has been posing an ever growing cyber security threat to the United States beginning with Hauwii brand cell phones that are made in China and send data stored on the phones back to the Chinese government, especially photographs and especially photographs taken on United States military bases and/or photographs of United States military equipment and United States federal buildings. Any photographs or video taken on these phones or by this application will be sent back to the Chinese government so if you have this application on your phone you should delete it immediately and if you have one of these Chinese cell phones you should purchase a different brand phone, delete all information from your Chinese made phone, ensure all data, including cloud data and sensitive personal information has been erased as well and once that has been completed you should remove the phones SIM card and then burn both the phone and that SIM card.
title: United States National Security Threat From China

review: This app is fantastic in every way. It functions correctly, there are little to no errors with the software and I believe the toxicity is monitored fairly well. While all of these things are true, there is still a major issue that people are failing to recognize. This application is designed in a manner that keeps you staring at your phone all day. The developers want you to be on tik tok all day long. The more you stare at your screen, the more ads you see, the more everyone other than the user benefits. Don‚Äôt you realize that you're the product in this scenario. What‚Äôs being sold is your time. While developing the application, tik tok knew this and created an intricate AI system that curates what you like and what you‚Äôre interested in to be on your fyp. This very detail and tactic is what keeps people staring mindlessly into their phones for hours on end. None the less, the app is for the most part good other than the dances. However, I feel it is necessary that people are aware of this kind of information. Have a blessed day and thank you for reading.

So I think it would be really nice for users to have the option to have provided subtitles that you can turn on and off in the users settings, which would also correspond with the users language choice. This action would be a great help with people who have hearing problems and either can‚Äôt hear what the song is saying or what the person on screen is. review: Honestly, I like the part where people of all ages get together and relate, but some teens abuse the platform and completely neglect duties such as school, possibly work, and spending time with family. People can talk about dirty things such as s*x, p**n, private areas, smoking, d**gs, etc. Viewers can spend hours scrolling which can cause loss of memory and waste time. It is also a toxic platform where children are exposed to harmful ideas and harmful people (Charli and Peaches). The privacy policy is also ‚Äúastronomical‚Äù as TikTok‚Äôs headquarters is in China and it is a Chinese company. They are allowed to view pictures, videos, messages, and personal information on your phone and save the data without you posting any of it. Also according to law in China, all the information must go to the government of China, which is pretty scary and ridiculous. Overall, I believe I should be giving it a 1.5 due to its privacy policy and effect on growing teens. Also, I am not a Karen, I am a ( [an]almost)teen who cares more about school than scrolling mindlessly through an app all day while China‚Äôs GDP goes through the roofs.

review: I love the app, and though learning how to film and edit does have a learning curve, it‚Äôs still one of the best, most efficient editing programs for quick videos. However, one thing that frustrates me, and that I Hope will change with future updates, is the inability to continue filming / continue shooting once you move onto the ‚Äúediting‚Äù portion. If you move onto the editing portion, trim a clip, then want to go back and film an additional clip, you can‚Äôt. Your trimmed edit will NOT be saved, so if you were trying to trim a section to be able to have space to film a new clip, you can‚Äôt. This is particularly frustrating if you filmed most of the video a day or two ago, and want to trim some clips, and go back and film some new clips to add to it. You can‚Äôt. You receive the error message that ‚Äúcontinuing shooting will erase all edits‚Äù but, there‚Äôs no way to trim a clip during the initial filming process either! You‚Äôre screwed either way! Trimming clips and adding new clips to a saved draft is a must in this app, when most videos rely on transitions that may be filmed days or weeks apart from one another.

review: The concept of Tik Tok is great. Letting people express their creativity, whether it be in the form of comedic jokes, cosplay, or art is a great idea. That‚Äôs supposed to be the concept, but thats not how its played out. Recently, Tik Tok has changed the algorithm to where its really only popular content creators that show up on the for you page and in the hash tags. Small accounts can‚Äôt compare and their content gets hidden by a shadowban, which is the process of putting a suspension on your account without you knowing. You can continue to post videos and comments, but rarely will they ever be seen. In order to get on the for you page, it needs to seem like you‚Äôre chasing clout, whether thats stealing someone‚Äôs content, doing something incredibly stupid, or looking cute. Only sometimes will you see original ideas produced by small accounts that get the views they deserve, other then that, its the same popular creators. It would be nice to see a change. It would be nice to see the shadowban disappear and the for you page include more small creators so that they can be discovered for their talents as well.  Also, the customer service is awful, that needs fixed.

review: I was addicted but a year ago I decided to delete the app when I realized I was spending a large percentage of my life staring at people I don‚Äôt know participate in an endless cycle of trends. I‚Äôve noticed a drastic improvement on my life as a whole. Now I look at people who devote their lives to this app and feel pity for them. It‚Äôs such a waste of life and does nothing but turn you into a clone of everyone else on this god forsaken app. The entirety of the tiktok population is made of extremely gullible followers who are incapable of thinking for themselves. Once you delete the app you‚Äôll see that everyone who has the app thinks exactly the same. People see things on tiktok and believe it instantly instead of questioning it. They take these strangers word as gospel and believe it without doubt. It is truly troubling that so many people in this world are this way but, I digress.  Please take my word for it, you will never regret deleting tiktok. I was an avid user for years, even before it was tiktok. It will be hard at first but once you get used to using your brain again I promise, it is worth it.
title: delete tiktok, you will not regret it

review: I really enjoy TikTok because not only am I entertained but I learn a lot. For a while I was able to create lists to save my favorites under that I could easily reference. From recipes to funny TikToks, fashion and style, home renovation tips, knowledge, business tips, and yes videos I wanted to create content with I was able to create a library of tiktoks that‚Äôs completely gone after my recent phone upgrade and app update. Now I have over 500 saved videos and no way to truly go back to reference or share what I liked. That‚Äôs the reason I only gave 4 stars. I also don‚Äôt like that my content isn‚Äôt pushed out to my followers on a consistent basis. With over 100k I‚Äôm surprised my videos don‚Äôt average at least 10% of that in views. Some vids top at under 1k views total. It feels like TikTok decides on what content you create vs me creating content around myself as a brand.
title: Why Remove Saved Vids Organization?

review:
This app constantly promotes young shirtless (some Under 18) boys doing nothing but saying ‚Äúlet‚Äôs go let‚Äôs go let‚Äôs go‚Äù and real creators have no actual incentive and are not promoted by the platform and in fact suppressed. Real creators recieve frivolous bans for no reason. I‚Äôve had friends banned who played non violent video games (animal crossing) and do not even speak in their lives. 

They also grant special privilege to certain creators ‚Äúon a case by case basis‚Äù. What the ‚Äúcase by case basis‚Äù means is just white straight men. Basically stream keys for computer streaming are NOT given to ANY LGBTQA+ persons, or people of color and all people able to go live that I‚Äôve seen have been white straight males. This is because people at tik tok are only choosing cis white straight men to promote. (Why? I don‚Äôt know.) 

Furthermore there‚Äôs a fraudulent sales tactic. Gifts are bought by in app purchases yet are about 30% cheaper when bought through the website opposed to the app. This is basically scamming people out of their money and this is never made known to people purchasing gifts or using this platform.
title: Discriminatory/racist corporate behavior and fraudulent sales tactics

review: If you have ever been in a tiktok comment section you will know they are notorious for being some of the coldest, harshest, untamed parts of app as a whole. Regardless of if it‚Äôs children calling me slurs, or adults telling me my disability isn‚Äôt valid, this creates a dangerously toxic environment for everyone on this app, especially those of us in marginalized communities that can never catch a break. If you are a parent, I recommend keeping this app away from your children because they WILL end up shamed and hurt by strangers who know nothing about them. If you are a teenager, I recommend keeping to yourself on this app as much as possible. Once you start to interact with others it becomes a downward spiral of people misinterpreting you and picking fights like they are being paid to do so. Lives on tiktok need more moderation as well, as we cannot trust all users to be our moderators. People will enter my lives, call me fat (I‚Äôm not even fat), insult my religion, and don‚Äôt get any punishment from Tiktok to be better. Prove you care about communities that you don‚Äôt belong to and take out the trash before the trash ruins your app.
title: Everyone is rude for no reason.

review: The choke hold that this magical magical app has over me is insane. I‚Äôm on it every day, morning or midnight, rain or shine, sick or well, for at least a few hours at a time. It‚Äôs my only safe space online because the community is supportive and the app itself breads creativity. Every time I open the app to view a video it‚Äôs an opportunity to learn more about myself, other cultures, and the latest trends in pop culture. I can‚Äôt believe I ever used to think differently about it because of bias in the media. It‚Äôs the highlight of my day because it almost feels like hanging out with a friend who saved a box full of things they picked up for you when they thought of you randomly because they thought you would like it. There is so much power in the users of TikTok because they are empowered to be unique and united as one whole community and it‚Äôs a beautiful thing to be a part of.

review: At first Tik Tok seems great. Humor, life hacks, dancing. But the more you watch the worse it gets. People who speak the truth and try to raise awareness about certain issues get their posts flagged and taken down because the video ‚Äúgoes against community guidelines.‚Äù Meanwhile there‚Äôs literal children posting inappropriate content and then being sexualized by people of all ages in the comments, and those things continue to stay up. There‚Äôs honestly a lot of very awful things on this app that not everyone wants to (or should) see. There‚Äôs also a lot of bullying on this app. If you read the comments on just about any video there‚Äôs always something negative. Usually it‚Äôs attacking someone‚Äôs appearance, which can be very detrimental to some users. And although a user can turn the comments off they shouldn‚Äôt have to fear being bullied online for making a post. On top of all this they're trying to silence the BLM community by banning their hashtags. Tik Tok is definitely discriminatory towards a lot of different people, and the longer you‚Äôve had the app the more you start to notice.  Tik Tok needs to get it together because its priorities are clearly not straight.
title: Not a good app

review:
Wow. I never knew you could go to silly Musically, to awesome TikTok.

SAFETY / PRIVACY. When I first got Musically, I thought one thing: Private. Account. Now. The programing for Musically privacy was ehh. The programing for TikTok with privacy was incredibly done. You just send requests to people you want to follow who have private accounts, and vice versa. Nobody can just look you up, and look at your posts/videos. My only doubt about TikTok is: You could look up a famous person on TikTok, and follow them, and chances are they don't have a private account. So you can look at whatever they post publicly. But overall, it's one of the best apps for children, teens, or even adults with the best privacy and safety. (Think about it as Instagram for a "kinder") When you put your age, it has a range. What I mean is that there is a "For You" area where you look at posts that might interest the age put in, so if you are say 11 years old, it will only show appropriate content.

Anytime theres an issue with the platform, they fix it and they do it ethically. they noticed that people were spending way too much time on the app and so they instituted periodic reminders to take a break and an app functions that allow you to monitor your screen time. However, me and  people I know who also use this app- have been experiencing difficulty and frustration with the constant updates. They liked some of the format of tiktok BEFORE the updates, but some of the updates are good, or don‚Äôt interfere that much with the communication aspect, so I‚Äôm not exactly too caught up in that just yet- However, the limit of only letting you follow 1000 people- which I know may be a lot- I feel like this limit should be exceeded, as I would like to follow more creators and be able to gain more mutuals on the app; I feel like this would overall improve my experience, by a lot. review: Everyone!!! Watch out when downloading this app in the future, hackers from everywhere are roaming on it and finding ways to hack your device. review:
Subject: TODAY'S WORD:  Listen Closely and Follow 

Listen Closely and Follow

TODAY'S SCRIPTURE:

I will instruct you and teach you in the way you should go; I will counsel you with my loving eye on you.
Psalm 32:8

TODAY'S WORD:

Many times we don‚Äôt realize that God is speaking to us. We feel an impression on the inside, a prompting to be good to someone. That‚Äôs not random. That‚Äôs God talking to us. Or, maybe you‚Äôre in a situation where you feel an uneasiness. Something says, ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs not right. Stay away.‚Äù That‚Äôs not just your nerves. It‚Äôs God protecting you. Don‚Äôt ignore it, don‚Äôt talk yourself out of it; just obey. If you‚Äôll follow that still, small voice, God says He will guide you along the best path for your life. If we‚Äôre listening to His still, small voice‚Äîthe promptings, the suggestions, the alarms‚ÄîHe will save us from heartache and pain. He‚Äôll lead us into promotion and favor. Too often we feel these impressions on the inside, but we dismiss them as not making sense, or override or overanalyze them. Don‚Äôt talk yourself out of it. Just obey. Anytime you obey, a blessing will always follow.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

‚ÄúFather, thank You for loving me and for speaking to my heart. Thank You for giving me an inner ear to know right from wrong. Help me to be sensitive to Your still, small voice and hear it with clarity, to hear any alarms, promptings, and suggestions, and to be quick to obey. In Jesus‚Äô Name, Amen.‚Äù

title: TIKTOK

review:
The funny thing about tiktok is that its not just an app. Its not just a place where you can watch funny videos of people falling down or dogs reacting to triggering sounds. Its a place where the outcasts, the forgot, the overlooked, and ones even close to death can find a home. Its a place where you can be a as creative and/or as crazy as you wanna be. This is a place where no matter what, you are excepted. Where you can be you no matter what anyone thinks. Its a place where, no matter how young or inexperienced you are, you CAN be heard! This app has saved peoples lives. This app has brought people home. The best friendship and longest relationships have been made on this app. People who were not able to get a job (for whatever reason) now have something that can kickstart them and get them back on their feet.
Tiktok is not just an app, it‚Äôs a home. Our followers are not just random boys and girls, they‚Äôre our family. 
Thank you. <3

title: Scammers

review:
The app has a phenomenal algorithm, I'll give credit where it's due. But for some reason, every time an ad shows up they choose to throw that algorithm away and sandwich the ad between two videos with millions of likes that have absolutely no relation to any of the content that you like. It sounds minor, but with the amount of ads you inevitably see when you're scrolling for hours (because we all know you will) it gets genuinely frustrating seeing so many videos that could not pertain to your interests any less. The algorithm is incredible at holding attention as is. Hiding ads between popular videos I don't even want to see isn't going to make me any more likely to watch them. If anything, it has made me more efficient at scrolling past them because when a video with a ton of likes and no relation to me shows up I already know that an ad is up next.

You have a good algorithm. Use it.

title: I‚Äôm talking to TikTok

review:
Tik Tok has been my escape.  I was a very carefree, carpe diem, hippie bohemian chick back in the day....when I was in my 20‚Äôs.  I have been married for 15 years and I am going through the divorce from hell.  I try to stay positive for my kids and this app has enabled me to have fun and step outside my real life stressors.
It would be awesome to be tok tok famous like my son and his gf, but Only because I think it would offer an opportunity I need right now to make extra income.  I am a little jelly of all the millennials who can ‚Äúwork‚Äù by obtaining sponsors to make a living making videos.  I want to be them.  He he.  This old broad would love to live free again in a tiny home on some land in my current town.  I would love to be a reality show and focus on videos and blogs and writing.  
This app lets the pieces of me, that exist from my past, resurface as reminders that deep down I am still fun and I can rise above whatever situation I am facing.
Thank you tik tok!!

some parts of the app are really messed up

-the music library isn‚Äôt complete, tons of songs (not just unpopular songs or new ones but full songs that‚Äôve been engrained into pop culture) are missing

-the video editing on the app itself is a little confusing and if you mess up on one part in the beginning but then do fine on the others you‚Äôd have to delete the whole video to fix that one beginning part

-sometimes the musics off

-when downloading your own videos, it keeps the watermarks on them and your name/title on the end (which I just personally think should be an optional thing :/) 

-you it won‚Äôt play songs longer than 15 seconds (atleast for me, idk if others have this exact problem) 

-when videos get taken down they rarely have an explanation to why they did, you just get a message saying basically ‚Äúthis video was taken down because it violated the community guidelines.‚Äù But it doesn‚Äôt say which guideline the video violated and it doesn‚Äôt give you any chance to truly make it up besides typing something up saying ‚Äúcheck it out again I think you messed up‚Äù which is overall a really bad way of trying to fix this 

Anyways, I love the app, it‚Äôs funny and is a meme goldmine and I‚Äôve made some friends through it and I just love the culture in my part of the app, and the whole mood is an absolute whole mood, but it has some problems that definitely need to be fixed as soon as possible.

I understand if a video is breaking the guidelines but there are some videos that are simply spreading awareness about a topic and not breaking guidelines getting banned and their videos removed. They are also known for banning people for no reason. They will ban you without warning rather they banned you by mistake or they banned you because you were breaking community guidelines or if they banned you simply because you would be making too much money in the creator fund. But if your account got banned and you believe it was by mistake so you try and reach out to tiktok you get met with either horrible customer service or just no reply at all. Tiktok is aware of these complaints but continues to ignore them and do nothing about it. If you are downloading this apps in hopes of being a content creator then your chances are very slight because tiktok will silence your voice.

review: TikToc is built around a fine premise that works really well. However the app is run through a proxy for the Chinese Communist Party, an authoritarian regime that has no regards for human rights or privacy whatsoever. The company executives would have the public believe that it is an independent company, however recent moves by the Hong Kong based airline Cathay Pacific show that even companies based in the semiautonomous region of Hong Kong are not truly independent. How can anyone expect a company based on the Chinese mainland to be independent from the CCP. Not only does TikToc propagate CCP censors, but it does so across the entire world including North America and Europe where the freedom of speech is legally protected. Not only that, but the company collects users private data. For these reasons it is implored that TikToc is no longer supported. Delete your accounts and apps. As for an alternative look to Dubsmash, an independent platform that provides a similar service. If Dubsmash does not fit look up other alternatives. TikToc is not worth the trade off though. Do not throw away your freedoms in support of totalitarian killers for a quick video and chuckle. Take a stand for what is right, delete TikToc.
title: TikToc is not worth the trade off

I‚Äôve only had Tik Tok (formerly Musically) for maybe a year or so now. When I wasn‚Äôt more popular I was ignored, & fine with this. While you can report, most of the time your sucky system will take down videos that don‚Äôt have any actual guideline violations, yet keep these useless troll accounts up (mostly children to teen dweebs wanting clout). You have an automated system that is honestly distasteful & useless, & you have all these tiny children (I am talking half the age of the recommended age) trying their hardest to be little brats because you don‚Äôt do what they want you to do, so they report. & your videos get taken down. You also don‚Äôt monitor potential pedophiles & accounts that post porn on there, where minors can easily access these things.
If you don‚Äôt find a way to fix it, eventually this app will burn to the ground.

title: Funny videos

review:
Tik Tok, owned by the Beijing-based ByteDance, is a dangerous and potentially nefarious app that has the ability to steal your personal information. They also engage in censorship and extreme content moderation, which pushes content they deem friendly and suitable to the top, at the expense of minorities and that which is critical of the company or China and the Chinese Communist Party. The owners of Tik Tok have also segregated content between mainland China and that outside China, by way of an app called Douyin, which for all intents and purposes, is tik tok. This is done for the explicit purpose of stifling dissent, and ensuring the content is absolutely, 100%, Pro-China and Pro-CCP. Regardless of your own opinions about your own personal information being stolen by a company with strong ties to the Communist Chinese government, you should all be wary of a company that, instead of allowing a platform for dissent, they actively and explicitly prohibit such speech against the murderous regime in China, allowing the citizens to be only fed the state propaganda of the communist party. 

Please, if not for your own sake, but for the sake of every good person living in China and the territories it occupies, do not download or support this app or company in any way.
title: Tik Tok: You‚Äôre Privacy

When I tell you that there are people who comment questioning the content creators, I mean that there are a lot of them stating they reported but has taken no appropriate investigation or action to prevent specific things from hate speech to animal cruelty. I noticed many racist videos on my feed and I don‚Äôt use this app a lot. I reported it to only get a response that it never violated their community guidelines and thanks for submitting it. So I guess you can make fun of others, be racist and offend people but as long as you comment that it was a joke, it shouldn‚Äôt violate the community guidelines? I also heard that other people‚Äôs videos that doesn‚Äôt violate their community guidelines got their video taken down. So I guess it means that they are very selective and only take action if there are many people stating the same thing.

review:
Inconsistent applications of the content moderation guidelines make it so there is a lot of troubling content on this app. Just this week I have seen copious amounts of drug usage (and when I reported these videos I was told they didn‚Äôt violate the content moderation guidelines). Other videos I have reported and have been left up include (non-educational) hate speech, anti-Semitism, racism, sexism, homophobia, copious amounts of harassment and doxing, jokes about abusing the disabled and more that I found incredibly troubling. Users who post content and comments like these are usually not punished. 
I‚Äôve also seen a lot of very good, educational content taken down. This was content that was talked about respectfully and in regards to social issues that need to be addressed.
I decided to sit down and read through the recently updated guidelines and was impressed by the amount of information they included, however it is already clear that those guidelines were simply released for show.
If your child has this app, have a talk with them, please know it is NOT a safe place and TikTok needs to be held accountable.
title: Inconsistent and unsafe for minors

There are some very creepy individuals on this application and I hope that all of the parents of these children are keeping an eye on what people are sending them and the content that their children are putting on this app. Other than that the community, in a whole, is such a fun place to interact with others. This app gives you an opportunity to show people the things that are going on in your life. It also gives others the opportunity to know you on a personal level. And it opens such a giant door to meet new and awesome people across the country and even across the world.

review: The app is fun, but there have been some recent changes that are downright nonsensical. Recently, an option for ‚ÄúI don‚Äôt like this‚Äù was added to the report system for livestreams and videos. This is a HORRIBLE IDEA. The entire point of the open system that exists in TikTok is that if you don‚Äôt like something, you KEEP SCROLLING. If it‚Äôs really that bothersome, you can block the creator or long press the video and select the ‚ÄúNot Interested‚Äù option so you‚Äôll see less of that kind of video. Why on earth would anyone think it‚Äôs a good idea to allow people to get an account suspended or a video removed just because a viewer ‚Äúdidn‚Äôt like it‚Äù? If the livestream or video on question violated the Guildelines (doubtful), then allow it to be reported for a legitimate reason. ‚ÄúI don‚Äôt like it‚Äù is never a legitimate reason to suspend or remove creators or content. I really hope TikTok will remove that option ASAP, since it means creators will be moving to other platforms for their streams. I know of at least 4 creators who have already done so.

title: Fine, I gave in!   Dad opinion

review: My name is Yoshikage Kira. I'm 33 years old. My house is in the northeast section of Morioh, where all the villas are, and I am not married. I work as an employee for the Kame Yu department stores, and I get home every day by 8 PM at the latest. I don't smoke, but I occasionally drink. I'm in bed by 11 PM, and make sure I get eight hours of sleep, no matter what. After having a glass of warm milk and doing about twenty minutes of stretches before going to bed, I usually have no problems sleeping until morning. Just like a baby, I wake up without any fatigue or stress in the morning. I was told there were no issues at my last check-up. I'm trying to explain that I'm a person who wishes to live a very quiet life. I take care not to trouble myself with any enemies, like winning and losing, that would cause me to lose sleep at night. That is how I deal with society, and I know that is what brings me happiness. Although, if I were to fight I wouldn't lose to anyone.

What about finding out what‚Äôs really going on (real or imagined) in the world or just watching the cutest animals doing absolutely adorable or funny things? Lastly, get invested in other people‚Äôs drama - without being involved or checking out what your favorite celebrity is doing today? All these things, and more, are available here on TikTok - in fact, you can also be the one people are checking in on... it‚Äôs fun, entertaining, heartfelt and can provide lots of amusement.  Best social media platform available- WITH NO ADS - that is free and easy to join!  Hope you join, and look forward to seeing what great stuff you come up with!

review: My biggest question is, why does the amount of likes you have change if you delete a video, I think you should really change that. People may have had 18k, for example, on a video that they no longer want posted. Sure you can make your videos private but then you have to scroll forever and it‚Äôs just very confusing to look through your videos. Maybe try to make it so that we can keep our likes when we delete a video, or maybe make another section for our videos that were put in private. So we have the videos we like in one spot, we have our posted videos with our drafts on another spot, so maybe we could add another section for our private videos. Another idea is all your posted videos we be under one of those sections, the all your private videos and drafts could be in another section, and then of course you have your liked videos section. Please consider these! It‚Äôs very important to many users, and please respond to me to at least let me know you read through this and will think about it! Thank you!
